description:
OUTFITTERY is Europe’s biggest Personal Shopping Service and we have a clear mission: We build the future of menswear shopping. Our goal is to make men happy!
Are you interested in building products used by hundreds of thousend of people? Do you like delivering code at a rapid pace? Outfittery is seeking an experienced Frontend Engineer (m/f) that is passionate about building mobile and desktop web applications. This position is full-time and is based in our Berlin office.
 
Your responsibilities:


Implement the features and user interfaces of Outfittery products like the Outfit Recommender


Architect efficient and reusable front-end systems that drive complex web applications


Collaborate with Product Designers, Product Managers, and Software Engineers to deliver compelling user-facing products


Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues


 
Your profile:


3+ years of JavaScript experience, including concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES6. Experience with Angular/ExtJs/React is a plus


3+ years of HTML/CSS experience, including concepts like layout, specificity, cross browser compatibility, and accessibility


3+ years experience with browser APIs and optimizing front end performance


BS/MS in Computer Science or a related technical field is a plus

Effective oral and written English communication skills
You're ready to live in Berlin, Germany

 
We offer:

An exciting workplace in a motivated team with low hierarchies
A dynamic company with short and efficient decision making processes
Air, love, life and work in the Berlin Startup-Scene

 
Intrigued? Then send us your application with your salary expectations and possible starting date. Your contact person is Iris Hay.
title: Frontend Engineer (m/f)

description:
OUTFITTERY is Europe’s biggest Personal Shopping Service and we have a clear mission: We build the future of menswear shopping. Our goal is to make men happy!
You want to have a lot of freedom and deep insights, as well as personal responsibility? You want to get to know various personalities in a great, international team? 
Then become part of our team as a Senior Product Manager (m/f) and support our company on the way to even greater success.
 
Your tasks: 

Your main responsibility is for all product work in finance and operations, with additional responsibility for sales processes
You manage and lead development of rock-solid solutions in these areas, but also bring creativity to solving the challenges presented by our non-traditional eCommerce funnel
You develop simple intuitive interfaces to complex operational systems, both for customer-facing features and for internal tools
As such, you are able and willing to help out as needed in other areas, e.g. frontend features, requiring a more explicit customer focus

 
Your profile:

You have a proven track record as a product manager
You have experience connecting external providers in fields like warehousing and risk check
Technical background is a plus, but mainly you are tenacious in grappling with a problem until you understand all its logical implications
You are able to express what is happening in a complex system using data, graphics, metaphor, whatever is necessary to make an informed decision together with your stakeholders
You have a passion for well-functioning processes, and for communicating these clearly; knowledge of BPMN is a plus
You value transparency, and have a knack for making even incremental progress tangible to stakeholders
You are unfailingly calm

 
We offer: 

A high level of personal responsibility and a great deal of creative freedom
An exciting workplace in a motivated team with flat hierarchies
A dynamic company with short and efficient decision making processes
Air, love, life and work in the Berlin Startup-Scene

 
Intrigued? Then send us your application with your salary expectations and possible starting date. Your contact person is Iris Hay.
title: Senior Product Manager (m/f)

description:
Snapchat is seeking an experienced market research professional based in our Venice office. In this role, you’ll design and execute cutting-edge research that will directly shape the future of the Snapchat experience for users and marketers alike.
What You’ll Do: 

Work cross-functionally with different teams at Snapchat to identify and execute world-class quantitative and qualitative research
Evaluate proposals from third-party research firms and build relationships with research partners
Responsible for scoping and context-gathering when planning new projects, evaluating traditional and nontraditional research methodologies
Design, write, and manage surveys with precision and attention to detail
Ensure flawless execution of all research, mapping back to initial scope and internal stakeholders’ business objectives
Analyze and interpret data to identify patterns and solutions
Create detailed, visually compelling reports in PowerPoint and Keynote

What You’ll Need:

3-5 years market research experience
Experience in the technology or digital media sectors preferred
Proven ability to excel in a fast-paced environment, work flawlessly under tight deadlines, and prioritize across several simultaneous projects
Strong research background using both quantitative and qualitative methodologies including questionnaire design, data analysis, and project management
Exceptional attention to detail with a keen eye for presentation design and conveying granular data in a digestible way; ability to tell a story based on research findings
Experience with advanced analytical techniques (e.g., conjoint, discrete choice, segmentations, etc.) preferred
Experience using progressive qualitative methods (e.g., ethnographies, online focus groups, etc.) preferred
Awareness of various research vendors and each vendor’s core competencies 

Love,Team Snapchat
title: Market Researcher

description:
DescriptionWith Babbel anyone can learn a language.
Whether on the go, in the subway or at home on the sofa, Babbel supports those who take joy in learning outside of work or school. Since its founding in 2007, the company has grown to become the market leader in app based language learning. In total, Babbel offers 14 learning languages, from English to Indonesian. Professional courses are steadily available via the Babbel website as well as on your smartphone or tablet. At Babbel more than 300 team members from over 25 different countries work hard to set standards for creating a new learning experience.
Changing the way the language learning is done is a great challenge, so we are looking for a Head of Controlling to join our Berlin, Kreuzberg office.

Your responsibilities will include:

Improve our (financial) planning and control systems to support the ongoing efforts in improving decision making;
Ensure timely reporting to all stakeholders and develop the reporting system and processes (fast-close);
Lead a team of controllers and work in conjunction with the Accounting and Analytics team in order to help manage day-to-day finance, marketing and business operations and provide ad-hoc services
Drive the budgeting and forecasting processes while reporting directly to the CFO
Improve and grow the FP&A function as an internal service for the business with a focus on marketing
Further build company-wide controlling standards and best practices
Proactively develop, refine, own and manage KPIs
Provide group trainings as well as individual coaching to raise controlling capabilities throughout the company




Requirements
7+ years experience in (financial) controlling, preferably in B2C and online business environment
Experience in building and leading a team of controllers and business analysts
Operational experience working with marketing managers and product managers in a technical environment
Experience defining and tracking business, product and marketing KPIs, knowledge of balance scorecard and similar approaches a plus
Experience with marketing attribution modelling is a plus


Hands-on experience with planning and analysis tools (ERP, SQL, Excel, etc.)
Experience in creating and maintaining dynamic models
Proactive and service oriented mindset coupled with a pragmatic getting-things-done approach
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Exceptional quantitative and problem solving skills


Advanced knowledge of business finance (accounting, treasury and financial controlling) is a must
Advanced knowledge of German GAAP (HGB) a must, experience of US GAAP and/or IFRS a plus


PLUS: experience with subscription models
PLUS: good technical understanding coupled with experience in application development environments

Benefits
You will change the way of learning for millions of users worldwide
Access to one of the most interesting business models in the industry 
A great product and highly motivated team that wants to push boundaries
Potential within a fast growing team with international and long-term prospects
A lively start-up atmosphere with friendly working hours
A vibrant international team from over 25 different nationalities
Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of Berlin
Great company benefits (high-end company bike, fresh fruit & drinks, Hackathons etc.)
title: Head of Controlling

description:

If you are passionate about building simple, secure, stable, AWS-based microservice platforms that support scaling and continuous scaling - we would love to hear from you! Responsibilities Build and run a sustainable, scaleable automated infrastructure (Chef, OpsWorks, CI, Monitoring etc.) for our AWS-based microservice architecture Improve our continuous integration and introduce continuous deployment pipeline Focus on platform security Support & enable the other feature development teams Help establish DevOps practices throughout the engineering teams 
Requirements deep experience in building complex web applications based on AWS services 3+ years experience in programming and architecting large-scale applications experience in building microservice-based infrastructure setups including monitoring experience in infrastructure automation (Chef, OpsWorks) experience in infrastructure Provisioning (Terraform, CloudFormation, Chef Provisioning, or else) passionate about implementing simple solutions for complex problems driven to multiply knowledge and educate teams about DevOps practices quality oriented and detailed focused can-do attitude and strong team player BONUS: Experience in Ruby on Rails BONUS: Experience in monitoring and metrics tools BONUS: Experience in agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban) BONUS: Willingness to engage in on-call shifts 
Benefits Tackle high volume, scaleable problems with a cloud-based setup and latest cutting-edge technologies The potential to change the way of learning for millions of users worldwide Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth Potential within a fast growing team Participate in hackdays, technology brown-bags Open source contributions A lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours Long-term prospects A vibrant international team from over 36 different nationalities Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Berlin scene Great company benefits (High-End company bike, fresh fruits & drinks, language courses) Check out our jobs page, our blog and our techblog to get an impression of how we work at Babbel!

description:
DescriptionWe are looking for a Team Lead Test Automation (full-time) to start immediately in our office in Berlin, Germany.Who we are:With millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms. How we work:Our agile delivery teams are working in full-stack and feature teams involving disciplines from product management, user interface design, user experience research, analytics and engineering. While transitioning our product to the new generation of language learning we are enforcing our teams with engineers capable to transition test automation more towards end to end user testing.Who we looking for:Preparing a major launch of our new product generation we enforcing our teams with test automation in the upper areas of the test automation pyramid. Therefore we are looking for a leader who is still keen to work as a QA engineer with focus on test automation within a Scrum team while building up a virtual team of test automation engineers working in the other Scrum teams. Apart from your leadership and management skills of course you have still have the passion for agile testing and its methodologies with a software engineer dedication to structured and high quality test automation code. Responsibilities Build-up & lead a virtual team of QA engineers for test automation within in our Scrum teams Ensure cross Scrum team harmonisation of QA practices Promote your testing domain in the company and establish best practices in the agile teams As team member of the virtual team also working in on Scrum team and Establish User and Component Acceptance Testing in your Scrum team Manage testing & defect and ensure delivery of high quality features Align BDD User Acceptance and Component Acceptance Tests with PO & the team Create & code BDD User Acceptance & Component Acceptance Tests in Cucumber Define & code Component Integration Tests Ensure transparency regarding quality status (metrics & KPIs) on a sprint basis 
Requirements 3+ years experience in test automation within a Scrum team 3+ years experience in at least one scripting software language, preferably Ruby or JS 1+ years experience in leading a team Very good knowledge of agile test and development methodologies Good ability to apply known test automation tools (e.g. Selenium, Appium) Experience with BDD, ideally using Cucumber or comparable tool Experience in multi platform testing (Web / Android / iOS) Good knowledge in continuous integration environments Good knowledge of software testing concepts & definitions Proven leadership skills A highly proactive, practical and self driven work approach Open minded, outgoing, positive personality with excellent communication skills Good ability to work methodological and conceptual Good attention to detail Fluent written and spoken English Optional: Experience with TDD, Unit Testing, Static Code Analysis Optional: Experience with test farms Optional: ISTQB® Certified Agile Tester or equivalent certification in testing Optional: Experience with JIRA, TestRail 
Benefits Leading a high-growth product engineering department to best in class agile quality assurance The potential to change the way of learning for millions of users worldwide Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth Potential within a fast growing team Participate in hackdays, technology brown-bags A lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours Long-term prospects A vibrant international team from over 36 different nationalities Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Berlin scene Great company benefits (High-End company bike, fresh fruits & drinks, Hackathons etc.) Check out our jobs page, our blog and our techblog to get an impression of how we work at Babbel!
title: Team Lead QA Engineer - Testautomation

description:
DescriptionBabbel is at the center of a language learning revolution. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms. Our customer base is broad, diverse and passionate about language learning. We’re about to embark on an exciting new journey to change the way people learn, and are looking for the best talents in the industry to get us there! You’re a natural champion for the user, and move with ease between the worlds of business, technology and consumer needs. You’re a communicator, versed at leading cross-disciplinary, international teams in solving real-world problems and needs. If you’re a strategic thinker with a knack for details, an entrepreneurial self-do’er not afraid to get your hands dirty to get a job done – we want to hear from you! In return, we offer fantastic opportunity to evolve within a dynamic and fast-growing environment. And, of course, you’ll be working on a product that improves the lives of millions of people. This is a full time role, based in the heart of buzzing Berlin, Germany.Responsibilities: Scope, define and drive the evolution of Babbel cross-platform product experience based on user needs and requirements Define, manage and execute product roadmap and release schedule, acting as partner between engineering, marketing and business development to ensure that deliverables are understood, projects and features prioritized and successfully delivered Own product backlog as Product Owner, and specify product requirements using user-centered, experience-driven specification methodologies such as user flows and BDD-styled user stories Work in Scrum Teams with engineers, design, didactics, data analyst and user research team in understanding, defining, executing and measuring new product opportunities Determine best methods to test potential solutions and gather feedback including market analysis, competitive benchmarking, identification of partner and consumer needs Influence the product strategy with other seniors and directors and manage key strategic initiatives - if required across multiple teams Establish shared vision across the company by building consensus and creating buy-in on priorities leading to product execution Work closely with marketing and business development to position and promote products as well as develop partner strategies 
Requirements Minimum 7 years product management experience with demonstrated ability to drive product decisions, lead cross-disciplinary teams and timely delivery of outstanding products Strong product and service with the ability to construct both big-picture and detailed roadmaps advocating stakeholder needs and business impact Extensive experience and skills in gathering requirements, understanding user needs, defining functional specifications in the form of BDD-styled user stories, wireframes and user flows to communicate your ideas to design, engineering and operational teams Proven skills in defining and upholding product and design frameworks, ideally with experience in designing platform solutions Well-versed and highly experienced with in agile product development philosophy and processes Proven track record in the end-to-end delivery of cross-platform solutions on time and within budget Proven creative problem solving and analytical, innovative mindset Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in fluent English, both written and spoken Ability to lead multiple, interdisciplinary and international teams to drive internal consensus and common goals Highly organised, self-motivated worker with entrepreneurial passion and ability to effectively multi-task Ready to coach and manage less experienced product owners BONUS: Knowledge and experience in education, health or other related areas BONUS: Startup, entrepreneurial experience. 
Benefits You will change the way of learning for millions of users worldwide A great product and highly motivated team that wants to push boundaries Potential within a fast growing team with long-term prospects A lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours A vibrant international team from over 36 different nationalities Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Berlin scene Great company benefits (High-end company bike, fresh fruit & drinks, Hackathons etc.) Check out our jobs page, our blog and our techblog to get an impression of how we work at Babbel!

description:
DescriptionWe are looking for an Agile Lead (full-time) to start immediately in our office in Berlin, Germany.With millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms. We’re about to embark on an exciting new journey to change the way people learn languages.Our agile delivery teams work mostly in full-stack feature teams involving disciplines from product management, UI, UX research, didactics, analytics and engineering. Our multi-team environment is scaling fast with our growth while we are adopting agile values, management and engineering practices.You are a passionate, experienced and pragmatic agile coach who has led successful agile evolutions in a multi-team environment spanning the whole value chain from product discovery to delivery. You are a person who understands the core of agile and lean and how to drive the adoptions of values and practices in order to create a high-performance product delivery organisation.You will drive the further evolution of our environment where everyone's common goal is to deliver an outstanding and exciting product to our customers as fast as possible and continuous improvement of our delivery is paramount.In your role, you will report directly to the EVP Product & Engineering.Responsibilities: Define, align and implement the agile strategy in collaboration with teams & management Lead and coach our ScrumMasters as agile chapter lead Ensure visibility on status of agile projects and help teams to fulfill their sprint commitments Work across teams and challenge to implement agile & lean practices Further improve team spanning artifacts & ceremonies (e.g. Global DoDs, All Team Retro & Continuous Improvement) Improve product delivery practices (e.g. elaborate backlogs, maintain roadmaps, release plans, reduce time2market etc.) Conduct team and department trainings Act as coach and consultant for individuals requiring your advise (incl. heads) Teach and coach by example (e.g. act as a Scrum Master, demonstrate agile practices) Promote Babbel as an industry leading agile product company

title: Agile Lead

description:
DescriptionJoin a fun, global team of top engineers, seasoned entrepreneurs, and taxi drivers for the adventure of a lifetime. We're changing personal transportation, making people’s lives easier, and opening up a multi-billion dollar market in the process.We’ve built a massive following in London, Dublin, Spain, and Singapore, with both drivers and passengers thrilled to finally have a great experience with cabs. Join us as we expand globally.THE ROLEWe're looking for and talented engineer hungry for solving business problems, and excited to work in one of the most impressive platforms in the business. We are all about micro-services, AWS, and serious scale. We want our engineers to move comfortably between product and platform development, and our Senior and Tech Leads to have the vision to see what is coming before anyone else.The flagship of our stack is our state-of-the-art micro-service platform: Go, RabbitMQ, ZooKeeper, Cassandra, NSQ, Memcached, and Java form the backbone of our technology. Our web stack includes Javascript, React, some Angular, PHP, and MySQL. Add to that Puppet, Jenkins, continuous integration, and a lot of automated tests with Selenium and Cucumber, and you got the picture: we deal with a lot of technologies. 
RequirementsIf you are an excellent developer, you are half-way there. Knowing Golang is the ultimate goal, but if you are proficient in C, C++, Java, or any top language, we trust you can pick up Go in a flash.Experience in the following areas and technologies are all welcomed: Go Cassandra Web Services and Micro-Service Oriented Architecture Messaging and locking patterns (ZeroMQ, RabbitMQ, NSQ, Zookeeper etc) Passion for maintainable, extensible, and reusable code as well as fast iteration Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms On the soft side, we expect you to lead some young and very bright developers, imparting on them your wisdom, your knowledge of best practices, and that perfect mix of “just getting things done” and “doing it the right way”.
Benefits Competitive Salary with Stock Options Flexible Working - we strongly believe in work/life balance 25 Days Paid Holidays Great Gear - we love Apple computers and big monitors - two if required. And what about us?Hailo is the evolution of the hail - a free smartphone app which puts people just two taps away from a licensed vehicle, and lets drivers get more passengers when they want them. A Hailo hail is accepted around the world every two seconds from Hailo’s global network of over 60,000 drivers and more than a million passengers. Launched in November 2011 Hailo has carried over twenty million passengers and grown to annualized sales of well over $100M.Founded by three taxi drivers and three internet entrepreneurs, Hailo has raised $100M from the best investors anywhere, including Union Square Ventures, Accel Partners, Wellington Partners, Atomico Ventures and Sir Richard Branson.Hailo is available as a free download from the iTunes App Store and Google Play. Simply search on "Hailo".
title: Lead/Senior Go Engineer

description:
We’re looking for a Senior Designer to join our award winning team, and help us deliver a wide range of projects across digital, social, print, content and everything in-between for our UK and Global clients.
This is a hands-on role: working within a collaborative environment to develop conceptual campaigns, set visual directions, create designs, collaborate on interactive outputs, and invent amazing products.
Big thinking. Forward thinking. We’re after a true designer at heart who wants to produce work that is usable, intuitive, intelligent and enjoyable. 
We’re looking for designers who live and breathe their passion, and now want to do it through the day instead of just on weekends. You care about attention to detail, and you realise that each and every piece of your work represents who you are. 
We believe in a strongly collaborative environment, and we’re looking for a strong visual designer advocate in the team, able to articulate complex principles and conceptual ideas simply, both verbally and visually.
We will need you to have strong communication and collaboration skills. You will be immediately immersed into a high-energy environment, where you will need to be confident and look for ways to constantly be challenged. 
We’re looking for those who aren’t afraid of taking the next step into the unknown. There’s no sitting back on your laurels. You will be taking a high participatory role within our creative team, to deliver real briefs for real clients. 
You will have a keen eye for detail, be able to follow process and a desire to learn and develop your skills, as well as getting stuck in when it’s required.
We promise to challenge you daily to grow both professionally and personally. You will be supported by Design Leads and the Creative Director, and will be fully encouraged to grow your skills base in a continuous learning environment.
This role is empowering, scary, exhilarating, and everything in-between. Come join a super friendly creative team, who are creating amazing work for big brands and having a laugh doing it all.
Besides, seeing your work out there at a global level will always give you goose-bumps.
 
What we’d like to see
 

4+ years or more experience in creating beautiful digital interfaces, touch-screen applications, and real world deliverables.
Solid knowledge of design processes, methodologies, and best practice principles.
Ability to multi-task, and stay organised to meet multiple deadlines across a variety of projects.
Capable of the drive and motivation to achieve perfection in themselves and others, whilst balancing the practicalities of agency life.
Ability to present simply, both eloquently in internal and external presentations, as well as in all visual communication.
A belief in risk-taking design, always pushing beyond the expected solution, and making something you would love to use.
Knowledge and awareness of Facebook, Twitter, Vine, Snapchat, Instagram, YouTube, and other social media channels.
Aware of development techniques (e.g. jQuery, HTML5, CSS etc) in order to achieve their creative vision.
A passion and desire to produce the best experience for a user no matter the channel or device, and a commitment to ensure it’s achieved throughout the project life cycle.
title: Senior Designer

description:
The role:
We’re looking for a talented and passionate designer to join our 7-person Design team and contribute to our style guide, iterate design changes and implement design principles across our entire platform as we scale.
As a Level II Designer, you will have an impact on all aspects of the product lifecycle, and you’ll work to map user flows, build high fidelity prototypes and oversee the development process. You’ll also have the opportunity to collaborate across different projects and teams, from dashboard workflows for our student ambassadors, to analytics tools for our Product Managers, to occasional marketing campaigns and wherever else you’d like to take the lead!
Here are some of the challenges you’ll take on:

Tackle complex problems and provide elegant, creative solutions that respectfully balance both business and user needs
Create interactions across various media including web, mobile and email and develop working prototypes in HTML, CSS and JavaScript
Produce sketches, flowcharts, mind maps, wireframes, mockups, prototypes and other designs as you iterate toward the best solutions to UX/UI challenges
Lead usability testing with the product team for the UI that you will be building
Actively researching and staying abreast of interaction design and relevant technology trends
Mentor and train other members of the design team

Our Ideal Candidate has:

2+ years of professional experience designing a web, mobile or other user-centered application for a web-based education, gaming or e-commerce product
Strong design skills in Photoshop and Illustrator, and other tools in Adobe Creative Suite
Strong experience with rapid prototyping and professional experience with HTML, CSS and JavaScript
A portfolio that showcases interaction and visual design projects, user research, and a strong grasp of design principles
Strong Understanding of the product life cycle as well as user-centered design processes and methods
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Digital Media or related field

Bonus points for:

Some experience in CSS pre-processors and Angular.js
Self initiated side projects in your portfolio
Experience in user research and usability test
Practical knowledge of Web, iOS, and/or Android development

What we’re offering you:

Industry competitive salary and stock options
Full medical coverage (medical, dental, vision)
401(k) program to help you save for the future
Regularly planned team events and outings
Free Friday lunches and an endless snack and drink supply
On­site amenities including a day spa, full­service cafeteria, 3 miles of nature walks along the Bay and free membership to a 7500 sq. ft. fitness center

About us:
Course Hero is creating a platform where students and experts can share and access great academic content they need to succeed at any time, from anywhere. Today, millions of students take advantage of our educational resources including study guides, flashcards and tutors.  We believe that improved access to knowledge enriches lives and increases future opportunities. Technology is revolutionizing the way we learn, and we’re committed to providing individualized support to students everywhere to help them expand their academic knowledge and professional skills.
Our company culture is very open, flat, and transparent. We succeed and learn together. We’ve tried hard to make this a pleasant and inspiring place to do creative work and it’s been working since we started out in 2008.
Most importantly, we seek to hire individuals whose personality, integrity and passion for our business make our team better as a whole. We’re growing fast, profitable (yes, it’s true for 4 years and counting!), and looking for new team members to push us toward the future.
Check out these videos to learn more about our company culture, and our company mission.
title: UI/UX Designer

description:
About us
Headquartered in New York and with offices in three states, Hometeam transforms the in-home care and aging experience by providing clients with personalized care planning, expert caregiver matching, custom mobile technology, and proactive care management to improve older adults’ health and well-being while giving their families peace of mind.
In order to support the Hometeam mission we are building a team of experienced engineers to create software that will improve the lives of seniors, caregivers and others in the home care ecosystem. There is work that is both straightforward, and more fundamentally complex.
About you

You are interested in not only writing software, but helping to build a company. You have the empathy and communication skills necessary to build strong relationships with colleagues on different teams to solve fundamental business problems.
You understand the fundamentals of computer science. You might have a relevant degree from a good school, but maybe not. Regardless, you know how to implement hashmaps and heaps and trees. You can discuss the difference between a breadth first and depth first search. You know what Big-O notation is and can tell us the running time of an algorithm.
In addition to knowing the theory, you also know the practice. You write clean code that is easy to understand. Instead of moving fast and breaking things, you take your time to do it right. You know that when it comes to being a great engineer it's all about the details.
You're interested in new tools and technologies, but you also found yourself nodding your head a little when reading Choose Boring Technology. You care more about getting the job done right than showing off.
You're comfortable starting with a blank sheet of paper and creating working code from scratch. You aren't intimidated and you will learn whatever new skills or tools you need to get the job done.
You want to do good work. You take pride in what you do. But you also want to go home at the end of the day. You wonder a little bit about the sanity of companies that expect their employees to live at the office.
You want to work with a team of co-workers that know what they're doing. You like being around people you can learn from, and people that you can trust to do a good job in their part of the world. You want a manager that keeps things running and can be a mentor, but not a boss that micro-manages your day.
You could get a job at Google or Facebook but don't really want to work for a big company. On the other hand, you might also be a bit disillusioned with the startup world, and wonder how many on-demand mobile-social-rating companies the world needs. You want to have a meaningful positive impact on people's lives.

If any of this sounds like you, then let's chat. Hometeam is going to be the next great New York technology company and we would love to have you on our team.
 
Hometeam is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description:
Twilio is looking to hire the Director of Marketing for APAC. The individual will be instrumental in launching Twilio marketing in the Asia-Pacific region. The ideal candidate must be a proven leader with a track record of success in breakthrough technology marketing to drive hypergrowth in the APAC markets.
About the job:

The Director of Marketing for APAC will be reporting into the VP of Global Marketing. You will be part of both the Twilio marketing team in San Francisco and the APAC team based in Hong Kong and Singapore. This role demands a steep learning curve around the company’s products, market, customers and competition. It needs a leader driven by a passion to make Twilio successful, has the entrepreneurial mindset to get things done, is motivated to lead by example, and will create valuable relationships both internally and externally for Twilio. 
You have a defined role, but in true startup style the working environment is ultra dynamic. You will need to be someone that thrives in a very fluid environment, eager to roll up your sleeves to DIY and regularly work outside of your comfort zone. 
You are obsessed with making Twilio wildly successful in the region, pulling out all the stops to make that happen. This is not a 9 to 5, Monday to Friday job and you relish that.
You will be working across multiple Twilio teams including Product, PR, Community, Developer Evangelism, Channel, Sales, Business Development and Recruitment.

Responsibilities:

You will own and execute all aspects of marketing and PR for Twilio in the Asia-Pacific region. You will be expected to formulate compelling ways to connect with your identified customers in the region and figure out how Twilio can address their pain points. You will be measured on building brand loyalty and product advocacy among our customers, and to use that to help bring new customers into the funnel and have them adopt Twilio for the long term.
You will define the marketing team in the region. As a marketing leader, you will be responsible for building, managing and coaching a high performance marketing team to expand Twilio’s marketing activities in the region over time.
The marketing team in APAC starts with you. The work include :

Lead all aspects of the marketing initiatives for the region together with the marketing team in San Francisco to raise Twilio’s profile and launch Twilio products in the region.
Build a highly effective marketing plan to drive demand generation, revenue, public relations, content marketing, web, media, content marketing, events and brand awareness in APAC.
Plan and execute Twilio-hosted events, such as our signature SIGNAL event (signal.twilio.com), Twilio roadshows, seminars and workshops.
Partner with sales to translate the strategic marketing plan into actionable quarterly targets and initiatives to achieve financial objectives.
Coordinate strategic marketing partnerships, including discovering the right local partners and maximizing the relationship benefits for both parties.
Speak publicly and represent Twilio at various external events.


Requirements:

At least 10 years of hands-on marketing experience in the technology sector or a startup environment in the Asia-Pacific region.
Proficiency in English is a must. Added proficiency in Mandarin / Japanese / Korean is a plus.
You're a proven DOer - you have led successful marketing campaigns (either social, PR, online, field, product, etc.), engaged the press and organized large and small events (meetups, parties, outings, conferences, tradeshows, hackathons, etc.) with demonstrable results. You are all about getting things done.
You get technology. Our customers are big enterprises and developers who often speak in jargon, and you can grok what they’re saying.
You are a self-starter and can operate in a remote role with little day-to-day supervision.
You’re a world-class communicator, both over the phone and via email. You can hold your own when speaking to a mass audience or engaging the press 1-to-1.
You're a team player but can also work independently, make decisions and are not afraid to work without a safety net.
You've achieved with limited resources. You understand ROI and know how to effectively apply it to everything you do.
You have a flexible attitude in regards to work, such as supporting evening and weekend events & travelling as required.

Bonus points:

You are super passionate about Twilio’s mission to disrupt communications and have a deep understanding of Twilio's value proposition.
You've worked with communications before and know how they work. You understand VoIP, SIP, WebRTC, Video, Messaging and great quality communication experiences.
You've worked with technology products that have targeted enterprises and developers with cloud-based services via evangelism, direct, online, and channel strategies.
You can build a Twilio app yourself.
A degree from a competitive University in Marketing or focused on writing: software or words - either's good.

About us:
Twilio makes communications easy and powerful. With Twilio's platform, businesses can make communications relevant and contextual by embedding real-time communication and authentication capabilities directly into their software applications. Twilio gives businesses the ability to innovate, prototype, create, and connect with their customers at the right time and in the right way. Founded in 2008, Twilio is privately held and based in San Francisco, California with other offices around the world. Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. #LI-POST

description: Company DescriptionTripigator is a platform which creates personalised holidays and let user book with verified destination wholesaler at a competitive price with Tripigator Experience Guarantee.Internet has solved almost everything. But Leisure travel is still the same from last 2-3 decades. Same stock itineraries and hassles to get or create personalised plan; same process of getting in touch with multiple agents and booking at higher price without any transparency and delivery guarantee. It's just painful.We have been through it and believe technology can solve the inefficiencies both on user and wholesaler side to make the whole holiday experience not just hassle free but also economical.We know for us, Indians, it's hard to believe a great product can come out of Indian Soil. (Question on Quora http://www.quora.com/Why-are-there-so-few-product-companies-in-India). Don't take our word for it read here! http://www.makeuseof.com/tag/best-trip-planning-organizing-apps-android/how and why people outside India are feeling jealous because we serve to Indian Travellers only. :)For Geeks: You must be wondering what is so difficult about putting a personalised holiday plan together! see Google Collaborating with NASA to use quantum computers to solve the problem. https://youtu.be/CMdHDHEuOUE?t=3m10s Are you excited now?Conde Nast Traveller: "Tripigator is more robust than most other apps available on the Android store. The itinerary-recommendation engine works convincingly" The app is being used by 50k+ users and created 350k+ personalised itineraries. The Official Itinerary Planner of Incredible India, Govt. of India. Featured in NatGeo Traveller:"The all-new Tripigator allows you to make and edit travel plans with your friends". and Economic Times, Financial Express http://www.tripigator.com/info?page=pressWe are based out of Bangalore. Working hard to make travel planning and booking frictionless and mobile.App Link: http://trp.gr/TripigatorAndroidApp Job DescriptionIf you have infinite fuel, do you think you can go a 1000 miles?No, not surely. It’s your car’s engine which decides how far you can make it.Your job is to design & develop such efficient engine to make the journey smoother yet the fastest one.Get it, no?Okay...You will be poured upon by structured travel data, massive data (ask almost anything, which contributes to a holiday planning & booking). You need to make IPE - Intuitive planning engine efficient to the ‘-est’. Make it async, use grid computing or cloud computing or clusters (ever heard these terms? No, please do not read further). Make use of anything or everything to make system fast-est yet robust without compromising on the scalability.Now, you get it for sure :-)QualificationsEligibility Criteria (EC = 0)If Data structures & Algorithms are like counting numbers on fingers algoExpert := 2 ^ 0 EC += algoExpertIf you can prove that any B degree in Computer Science from Tier 1 College, can not take over your past work experience expertise := 2 ^ 1 EC += expertiseIf you spend most of your time with linux, terminal & servers geekyness := 2 ^ 2 EC += geekynessIf you live on Java or scala or on any other server side language (we are not talking about Python here) loveSSL := 2 ^ 3 EC += loveSSL((If you are a fresher or have <= 1 year of experience) and CountBits(EC) >=2 ) or (CountBits(EC) >= 3) you are eligible for the interview.function CountBits(number): count = 0; while(number) { number &= (number-1); count++; } return count;Share your resume answering “why you are eligible for the interview process”Additional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.I'm interested

description:
DescriptionWe are looking for an Senior iOS developer (full-time) to start immediately in our office in Berlin, Germany.Who we are:With millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms.How we work:Our agile delivery teams are working in full-stack and feature teams involving disciplines from product management, user interface design, user experience research, analytics and engineering. description:
The successful candidate will join an exciting, fast growing American company that’s reaching millions of people in over 100 countries. They will be one of the first members of the Dublin technology team helping to change lives with innovative mobile solutions. This exciting challenge is ideal for an enterprising, hardworking and self-motivated test automation professional.
The right candidate will work in a fun, inspiring, agile scrum environment with a dedicated group of professionals and a commitment to excellence. The role involves designing, implementing and maintaining technical test solutions for mobile applications, while engaging in agile and preventative testing.
Experience:5+ Years
Salary:Negotiable (BOE)
Responsibilities

Design and implement test automation frameworks and support engineering practices
Sign off on quality of the applications as part of release cycle
Manage and promote the use of test automation tools.
Planning, managing and executing test cases and automation strategies for mobile and web applications
Automation analysis - identifying automation value and efficiency gains
Create and apply good engineering practices, coding standards and lead code reviews
Committed to helping the Scrum Team in any way possible to deliver on its goals

Skills and Specifications

Bachelor’s degree (Min 2.1) in relevant discipline or equivalent experience
Experienced in the definition, creation and management of automation frameworks, using functional and non-functional automation tools
Experienced with Appium, Selenium Web Driver or similar
Strong coding skills in Java, Ruby or similar
Offer an in-depth understanding of testing throughout the product lifecycle, both at code-level (unit testing) and application-level (system testing)
Strong analytical skills for defining/extracting automation requirements
Experienced in working with databases and a good knowledge of HTTP, mobile and web technologies
Knowledge of Agile, Scrum, XP, TDD and BDD
Experienced in influencing engineering teams and requirements processes to ensure testability of deliverables
Ability to write clear, concise, well-documented code that adheres to commercial standards; good appreciation of coding standards, design best practices and a keen desire to apply them

Competencies:

Team working and collaboration
Clarity and attention to detail
Initiative
Personal integrity
Demonstrated cognitive ability and love for learning

Company Values:

Open-mindedness (embrace a constantly evolving environment)
Relentless problem solving (take on anything attitude)
Action-oriented (proactively identify and solve problems to help our members)
Passionate about the company (do whatever it takes to help the company succeed)
Customer is #1 (always do what's in the best interest of our members)
Honesty and upfront communication (embrace a transparent and open environment)

description:
BOOK A TIGER is an online market place, where customers can simply and easily find reliable and trustworthy cleaners, for their home or small office. We are a young and fast growing Startup, situated in the heart of Berlin. Our team is well experienced (Founders and core team from Deliveryhero.com/Lieferheld.de), and together with your help we’d like to break into the competitive home cleaning market!
We plan to launch a new Business Unit in Amsterdam in near future, and are searching for a Managing Director, who will take on the exciting challenge of developing our Business Unit from scratch and work with us towards our vision of creating the most advanced and best product, for our customers, in the cleaning industry.  
What the role entails:

From our new office in Amsterdam you develop, together with our founding team, the strategy for our new business unit, including budgeting and action plan for the upcoming launch.
You analyse the market, our competition and our target audience, recognise opportunities and build the new business activities accordingly.
You will set up and execute a marketing and sales plan from scratch.
You will identify potential business partners and will be responsible for the contract negotiations.
You reach efficient business processes and continually optimise these.
You carry the responsibility of the budget and report the progress of the new business unit to the founders, on a regular basis.
You build a strong and successful team and are responsible for the management of personnel.

 
Your profile:

Successfully completed a business degree.
An Entrepreneurial mind set and determination, with a Hands-on & Get-it-done mentality
Excellent communication skills, in both Dutch and English.
Several years of professional experience, with a strong focus on Business Development and/or Marketing desirably in the following areas; New Business Development, Management, Hotel Industry, Cleaning Industry, Facility Management.
An affinity for technology, a well structured and independent work ethic, analytical thinking, and a strong interest in new business activities.

  
What we offer:

The rare opportunity of establishing a new business unit from the outset, and leading it to success.
A steep learning curve with many challenges and great entrepreneurial experiences.
Working with an ambitious, highly talented, and international team.
A transparent business environment, with direct action and Can-Do attitude.
Involvement in the overall success of the company by participating in the Virtual Share Program from BOOK A TIGER, a long with an attractive salary.

 
Have we peeked your interest? Then apply today with your CV, together with your earliest possible start date and your salary expectations. Please send your application documents directly to Anna Fishman, Head of HR (anna@bookatiger.com).
title: Managing Director for Netherlands

description:
DescriptionWith Babbel anyone can learn a language.Whether on the go, in the subway or at home on the sofa, Babbel supports those who take joy in learning outside of work or school. Since its founding in 2007, the company has grown to become the market leader in app based language learning. In total, Babbel offers 14 learning languages, from English to Indonesian. Professional courses are steadily available via the Babbel website as well as on your smartphone or tablet. At Babbel more than 400 team members from over 36 different countries work hard to set standards for creating a new learning experience.Talent Acquisition at Babbel is more then just a “filling requirements” task, it is the understanding that we strategically build teams and drive our business with the Talent we bring through our door. It is the complete on-going cycle of attracting, sourcing, recruiting and hiring employees. This includes elements of employer branding, outreach, networking and relationship building with potential, immediate and future candidates.Responsibilities: Develop and manage the full-cycle recruiting process especially for technical roles Partner with hiring managers to understand position specifications Drive sourcing strategies to attract best of class talent Identify, qualify and pre-screen candidates through agencies, job boards, social media channels, associations and networking events Create an exceptional applicant experience by going the extra mile: make sure applicants are always up to date and receive prompt, informative and personalized feedback Identify the newest trends in tech recruiting and implement new strategies to attract top talent Support our employer branding strategy 
Requirements At least four years of experience in recruiting and active sourcing of candidates, preferably in a high-growth start-up Familiarity with the challenges in international technical recruiting Strong knowledge of employer branding activities within the German tech start-up scene Ability to balance demanding hiring managers and candidate interests Structured thinking and solution oriented attitude Outstanding interpersonal skills and strong attention to detail Proficiency with applicant tracking systems and social media / networking tools Bachelor’s degree in business studies or psychology (focus on human resources is a plus) Fluency in English, German is considered a plus 
BenefitsWork at the center of one of Europe’s hottest internet companies Be part of a highly dedicated, lively and multicultural team Broaden your perspective and learn new things every day Informal working environment which cultivates ambition and originality Start-up mentality and attractive working environment in the heart of Berlin

description:

road. As the Manager for TnS in India, you’ll be responsible for thinking through every aspect of Safety related to Uber in the region. You’ll be one part incident response, one part trend analysis,
one part brand ambassador, and one part process innovator—working with riders, driver partners, and the Uber team through challenging and sensitive problems.
title: Trust & Safety Manager, India

description:
The person who fills this role will be part of the Global Procurement team and responsible for building and managing procurement within India. You will ‘think globally, act locally’. Your mission is to get the right deals from the right vendors at uncommonly optimised terms in highly expedited timelines in a very well managed and tracked way. From what we buy to how we pay….here is some of what you and the team you build (possibly 2 to 5 people) will do:
WHAT YOU’LL DO
- Strategic Planning & Results - Fully charged with defining and implementing spend visibility, commodity management and strategic sourcing.  Keeping executives in your region informed of key insights.
- Team Management – Build and manage team and infrastructure to deliver incredible value, risk management, and cost savings.
- Facilities and IT partner – Help quickly build cost effective offices and procure the right technology at the best price.  You will work with your team members that are deep category experts and other departments within Uber to develop an efficient and effective supply chain.
- Telecom spend – We’re global with over a million drivers on our mobile technology platform. You’ll team up with the Technology and Business teams to make sure we have the right deals at the right prices and help ensure a well managed supply chain.
- Contracts– You will negotiate as well as red-line and draft commercial terms to support 3rd party spend.
- Procurement Technology and policies – Lead the appropriate use of tools and policies to serve your region and Uber.
- Travel Policy– How we travel, where we stay and how we house people.
WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR
- 10+ years of experience in managing a global procurement process. Background in managing technology and facilities processes a big plus.
- Someone who wants to develop a global procurement program that’s not just an implementation of what’s been done before.
- Someone with the ability to simultaneously manage multiple initiatives while making a day-to-day difference.
- A team oriented leader. You will be interfacing with all levels of Uber employees, partners and vendors.
- Hands on experience and willingness to be “in the weeds”.
- Leadership and people management skills, internal as well as vendor and partner.
- A passion for Uber!
PERKS
-    Employees are given Uber credits every month
-      Ground floor opportunity to make a difference.
-      We’re not just another social web app: we’re moving real assets and real people around their cities.
title: Head of Procurement, India

Uber is looking for a Senior Marketing Manager to lead marketing efforts for our NYC team.  This is a critical role as it will help shape and oversee all marketing practices, both rider and partner driver facing, for one of Uber’s largest cities.  The role calls for a combination of strategic planning and analytics, business development, marketing, and leadership. The right candidate should be comfortable in an "all hands on deck" environment, love solving people problems and be able to thrive in a startup culture. 
 
We are moving a mile a minute to make sure that Uber users and partner drivers are able to experience the magic of Uber.  The Senior Marketing Manager will implement and advise on strategic initiatives that span brand, content, product positioning, business development and account management.

description:
Uber is seeking a senior brand design manager to lead, manage, and grow the regional brand marketing team. The role demands great execution, bold innovation, obsession with quality, fearlessness and optimism to be inspired by the unknown and never settle, solving problems with creativity while keeping the user in mind and ambition to take projects to the finish line.

 

WHAT YOU’LL DO

 


- Work among other exceptionally talented staff in a fast-paced, rapidly growing, highly collaborative environment. 

- From music festivals to marketing collateral, you will have the opportunity to give a local voice to Uber’s communications.

- Concept and execute both large scale and small scale brand expressions that are incredibly impactful and positive. 

- Push projects to a world class level conceptually. Craft and lead world class executions that range from illustration to environmental design.

- Manage and direct outside agencies in a variety of cross disciplinary executions.

- Help designers become a source of inspiration for marketing efforts and inspire marketing management to be even more potent.

- Teach designers across regions how to strengthen their voices to become a thought and creative leaders in their local markets.

- Enable regional teams to ship high quality design assets with minimal effects on velocity, maximizing quality, creativity, and timely delivery.

- Build team camaraderie and apply best practices in cross region knowledge sharing.

- Build the systems for you (and others) to effectively identify, evaluate and hire designers and writers who can take Uber to new levels of awesomeness. 






QUALIFICATIONS


- 8+ years of relevant visual design experience in print, interactive design, environmental design, social media, and/or direct marketing, preferably in a traditionally managed creative or digital agency environment

- 5+ years experience directly managing, mentoring, and building local and remote design teams

- Highly strategic and conceptual thinker with love of storytelling and that pushes creative boundaries

- Strong business acumen, with a solid understanding of how to achieve business objectives while meeting an expected brand standard and high bar for aesthetic quality



- Experienced overseeing relationships with brand consultancies and interactive agencies
title: Senior Manager, Regional Brand Marketing - India

description:
Uber is expanding quickly throughout Asia-Pacific and is looking for an experienced Financial Operations Analyst to join our growing Asia Pacific team!
 
Reporting to the Head of Finance, India, you will be key to India Finance operations to ensure payments to vendors & driver partners are processed accurately and on-time. Someone who doesn’t just plug and chug will be most successful in this role. Ideal candidate always asks the question “does this make sense?”
 
What will you do: 
- Highly Proficient with Accounts Payable process: Invoice processing & compliance, Payment processing and Travel/Expense Reimbursement processing.
- Ensure vendor invoices, driver payments and expense claims are paid accurately & timely
- Ensure SLA’s metrics & controls are met
- Participate month/year-end (close) activities to ensure AP accounts are accurate and timely reconciled to GL
- Work well with other functions to resolve issues related to AP
- Support development of work instructions and process flows
- Support & participate internal & external audit and related activities
- Lead and support process/projects related to Procure-to-Pay & Expense Reimbursement areas.
- Inclination and desire to continuously improve the Accounts Payable and P2P process
  
What you will need:
 
- University degree or diploma level in accounting and/or business discipline
- 3 years’ experience Accounts Payable / Banking payment process
- Must have Oracle R12 knowledge
- Strong excel skills
- Strong & clear communication skills on all level
- Knowledgeable of Process improvement & methodology
 
Perks:
- Employees are given lots of free Uber rides each month
- Make a difference: we’re not just another social web app: we’re moving real people/assets and changing transportation for the future.
- Work with smart, driven co-workers, in a fun office!

description:
Data Center Operations designs, installs & maintains the world’s largest Cloud Computing Infrastructure. We are looking for skilled Data Center Technicians with a passion for technology to help us expand our Cloud to the next level.
 Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers an exciting, dynamic and challenging environment encouraging creativity and personal development while maintaining AWS computing environments in a secure, scalable, and cost-effective manner.
 To keep up with demand on both disk and network capacity, we continue to expand our Data Centers in every region. Also, our content delivery AWS service, CloudFront, has expanded its Data Centers presence by over 50% worldwide in the last 12 months and are expecting to increase by a similar number over the next 12 months. This requires talented people to build & manage. We hope it is you!
 At Amazon, career progression is part of our environment. We want you to progress. If your career path is in Systems, Network or Database Engineering, Software Development or maybe AWS Support, Technical Operations or perhaps Project Management, we will create a development plan to enable you to succeed reaching those goals. This begins on Day One!
 Come and work for the world’s most Customer Centric Company.

The Opportunity: Data Center Technician

 This role is a unique opportunity to work in some of the most cutting edge data centers in the world. Amazon data centers are large-scale high-density centers where you will be working on changing the face of Cloud technology in the region.

 A Data Center Technician may be the primary point of contact for both internal customers (for example: Network Engineers, Systems Engineers, Software Developers, Database Engineers, Technical Operations) and external customers (Hardware Vendors, Contractors, Service Providers among others).


Responsibilities:
 There is never a dull moment as each day presents itself with different challenges. Some of the key responsibilities you will undertake are:
 · Problem Solving:
 o Maintain a high level of system reliability by prioritizing and resolving trouble tickets efficiently 
 o Intermediate Linux Troubleshooting
 o Primary point of contact for all Systems and Network hardware problems
 · Technical:
 o Troubleshoot technical issues on various platforms ranging from Systems to Networking
 o Remediation of physical layer outages, both Systems & Network
 o Remediation and recovery of physical power issues on racks
 o Participate in Data Center power and cooling incidents and escalate to relevant team
 · Operations:
 o Meet 24x7 shift and on call requirements and response during shift rotations
 o Install server racks in line with internal SLAs
 o Data Center point of contact for all High Severity issues
 o Hardware diagnostics and replacement of server and network devices and parts
 o Meet SLAs for our customer uptime
 o Enforcing Amazons Security best practices
 o Interact with third party vendors & contractors
 o Contribute ideas to improve operational efficiency
 · Project Management & Operational Excellence :
 o Deliver small to mid-scale projects including Data Center rollout
 o Participate in team meetings for metric analysis and project status updates
 o Help build the world’s largest Cloud infrastructure
 o Share knowledge with other technical staff on the best practices related to all service owner issues
 o Write and enhance technical and operational processes and procedures
 o Data driven analytical approach to resolving problem
 o Understands operational metrics and drive actions to achieve the targets
 o Perform tasks needed with minimal supervision
 o Participate in global conference calls and report status to management (tracking action items for cluster)
 o Make team more effective by proposing and introducing process changes
Proactively propose solutions to problems found and not just report issue
title: Data Center Technician - AMAZON Web Services, Singapore

description:
(Located in Singapore, covering Indonesia Market)

Would you like to be part of a team focused on building adoption of Amazon Web Services (AWS) with partners and prospective customers?

 Do you have the business savvy and the technical acumen necessary to help establish Amazon Web Services as the premier cloud provider?

The Customer Success Representative (CSR) will be responsible for all proactive outbound prospecting and lead development activity designed to qualify and progress prospects from lead status into sales opportunity pipeline. 

The Customer Success Representative will be an integral part of the business development and marketing organization, playing a critical role in qualifying marketing leads and providing input to marketing on which programs generate the most productive leads. Working in collaboration with marketing, inside sales and field sales, the representative’s primary objective is to deliver ‘sales opportunity ready’ tele-qualified leads for the sales team to drive to conversion.

The leads will be primarily generated through the marketing organization via a combination of events (offline and online), integrated campaigns and captured web traffic. The role will require for the representative to engage, nurture and validate leads to maximize the overall experience of target decision makers and IT contacts in organizations of all sizes. Once identified the representative will work in close collaboration with the AWS extended sales team to engage proper resources who will progress the lead.

Responsibilities:
- Responsible for prospecting and new business acquisition for assigned territory and meeting assigned quota of ‘sales opportunity ready’ tele-qualified leads established by the company.
- Ability to identify net new, cross-sell and up-sell opportunities during the tele-qualification process – influencing decisions through guidance and expertise.
- Ability to understand the sales process, manage competitive sales objections and position AWS solutions against competition.
- Capturing a clients' or prospect's requirements, exploring their business and/or technology needs relating to a marketing campaign or tactic and then validating the opportunity.
- Nurture responses through the early selling stages from notice to identify to validated, maintaining a relationship with prospects that are interested in solutions but do not currently meet the qualification criteria.
- Providing feedback to marketing and sales teams on the success and/or gaps of each tactic/campaign/opportunity identification activity to increase effectiveness.
- Achieve monthly and quarterly call volumes, tele-qualification goals, and sales pipeline targets.
- Provide sales team with detailed call notes on all tele-qualified leads - recording all customer information and detailed tele-qualification records
- Partner effectively with appropriate Inside / Outside Sales Representatives to pass qualified sales ready opportunities
title: Customer Success Representative (Indonesia territory) - based in Singapore

 As a Account Manager with Amazon Web Services (AWS) focused on Indonesia territory, you will have the exciting opportunity to help promote the growth and shape the future of an emerging technology. Your responsibilities will include increasing adoption, and market penetration across Indonesia. 

The ideal candidate will possess both a business development and technical background that enables him or her to drive an engagement at the C-level as well as with software developers and IT architects. He/she should also be a self-starter who is prepared to develop and execute against a territory coverage plan.

description:
- Develop creative multiplatform integrated marketing programs for various Comedy Central properties including tent poles and Comedy Central Original Programming.
- Work with Pitch team Integrated Marketing counterparts to create convergent, linear, and digital only sponsorship packages
- Work with linear and multiplatform production teams to establish opportunities and specific elements for sponsorship packages
- Oversee day-to-day execution of sponsorship elements after sell-in
- Work closely with the Pitch team, production team and cross functional Comedy Central teams to execute custom sponsorship elements.  This includes writing creative briefs, maintaining assets, coordinating with various departments to ensure all deliverables and deadlines are met.
- Review creative to make sure sponsors’ objectives are met and flag potential issues.  
- Work effectively with sponsors/clients and various cross functional departments to ensure successful implementation of sponsorship programs. 
-  Brainstorm ideas in response to RFPs that meet sponsors’ brand objectives while maintaining the integrity of the Comedy Central brand.
- Work with the Pitch team to create case studies for completed programs
title: MANAGER, INTEGRATED MARKETING - COMEDY CENTRAL

description:
- Develop creative multi-platform integrated marketing programs for various VH1 properties including awards shows and VH1 Original Programming.
- Work with the linear production and digital site teams to create multi-platform, linear, and digital only sponsorship packages for assigned Spike properties.
- Oversee day-to-day execution of sponsorship elements after sell-in for assigned VH1 properties.

- Work effectively with sponsors/clients and various internal departments to ensure successful implementation of sponsorship programs.

description:
The Analyst position will support the SVP of Measurement, Analytics and Insights group. The group is responsible for creating new measures and analytics across various data source for Viacom Media Networks. Specific responsibilities include:
- Work independently and with direction from the team Manager on daily/weekly/quarterly executive audience reports
- Identify and communicate trends and patterns in data through the use of Excel and PowerPoint
- Collaborate with other team members to develop ways to enhance the communication of industry and company news and trends to our clients
- Manage and coordinate research projects
- Calendar management and meeting organization across different groups
- Keep manager on track with regard to schedule
- Arrange/adjust travel as needed
- Create and submit expense reports
title: SENIOR RESEARCH ANALYST

description:
Nickelodeon is currently conducting a search for a Vice President of Development to oversee the development process from script phase through pilot production, providing creative guidance on all story materials, scripts, key hires and cuts. S/he will:
- Originate ideas for development and solicit pitches
- Establish and maintain strong relationships with writers, producers, management companies, and agencies
- Oversee staffing for new series
- Work with Nick Fellows to gain understanding of the live action development process
