title: VICE PRESIDENT, LIVE ACTION DEVELOPMENT

description:
The BET Networks advertising sales team has an opening at our West Coast Headquarters, in Los Angeles, for an Account Executive.  In this role, you will be part of a world-class media sales organization, selling ad time across and related marketing programs across all screens to Western region-based national advertisers.  Our ideal candidate will have strong relationships with Western region-based national advertisers and ad agencies.

Responsibilities:

- Execute 360 sales strategy that includes clients and their ad agency buying, planning and account groups

- Maintain constant relationship building with current and prospective advertising partners and internal sales support teams

- Develop network presentations, verbal and written pre/post sell efforts and account maintenance after sale

- Manage and develop a team of sales service executives and client service representatives
title: DIGITAL ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE

description:
OUTFITTERY is Europe’s biggest Personal Shopping Service and we have a clear mission: We build the future of menswear shopping. Our goal is to make men happy!
You want to have a lot of freedom and deep insights, as well as personal responsibility? You want to get to know various personalities in a great, international team? Then become part of our team as a Senior Product Designer (m/f) and support our company on the way to even greater success.
 
Your tasks:


Create cutting edge web-design for our product platform


You cooperate closely with our experienced IT/Product team


Work across platforms desktop, tablet and mobile


Produce UI design work for our iOS application


You support the frontend/web development department


Produce design work which optimzes web performance


You will produce designs based on wireframes and mockups


 
Your profile:


You have completed your studies in communication design, graphic design or similar


You have at least 3 years of experience in Web/Graphic Design


You are well experienced with Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign, knowledge in Sketch InVision, Mock up/Balsamiq would be beneficial


You are experienced in UI Design and have a strong understanding of UX Design


You have fresh ideas to contribute to our company


You are comfortable working independently in a high pressure environment


You speak English fluently, knowledge of German is a plus

You are a team-player and love to think outside the box

 
Our offer: 


A high level of personal responsibility and a great deal of creative freedom


An exciting workplace in a young and motivated team with a flat hierarchy


A dynamic company with short and efficient decision making processes


Air, love, life and work in the Berlin Startup-Scene


 
Intrigued? Then send us your application with your salary expectations and possible starting date. Your contact person is Iris Hay. Please make sure to apply in English.
title: Senior Product Designer (m/f)

description:
TV advertising is being reinvented through big data, predictive analytics and other audience segmentation tools that were previously only available in the digital world. Viacom Vantage, Viacom’s data-driven television platform, is at the forefront of this reinvention of TV advertising, and we are offering a select few individuals the opportunity to join our team.
In this role, you will be tasked with making the Vantage client and partner experience a competitive differentiator for Viacom by designing, implementing and tracking the end-to-end experience of working with Viacom Vantage from on-boarding through campaign management through reporting and analytics.
- Redefine Vantage client onboarding to significantly reduce the time and touch points required to launch a Vantage campaign
- Build automation framework to improve data sharing and transfers to support Vantage campaigns
- Define inputs, variables and supporting collateral for Vantage target segment definitions to smooth onboarding of client target segments
- Define reporting rhythm for Vantage clients, including design and delivery of performance reporting throughout entire campaign
- Create framework and scorecard for monitoring partner process throughout the year for all Vantage partners
title: Product Manager, Partner Experience

description:
Why deliver for Foodee?

Highest paying food delivery job in Austin.
Bonus for delivery performance.
Flexible schedule if you have another job.
Paid training and development.
Best perk - The occassional FREE Foodee meal!

Are you free every day from 10:30am - 1:00pm and own a reliable vehicle? You could make around $50 a day delivering food to coprorate clients around Austin for one of the fastest growing startups, Foodee. Perfect for students, actors or people with an evening job that want to make quick money!
Foodee works with the city's best restaurants to provide delicious, healthy, and sustainable food to the best teams. We are a fast moving, growth orientated company serving clients in Vancouver, Toronto, Austin, Denver and Philly. At Foodee we are all about a great food experience and are ambassadors of the “wow!” service philosophy. We strive to always provide our clients with top notch order accuracy and on-time delivery.
You will be sent your delivery schedule 1 day in advance for you to review. The average food delivery takes only 30 minutes. For each delivery you will be paid $15. The number of deliveries during the lunch rush can range from 2-4 depending on your experience and our daily demand. You won't be standing in line to place orders or handling money. Deliveries outside of Central Austin and larger orders will be eligible for additional compensation. There is some opportunity for morning and afternoon deliveries.
Eat Well!
title: Highest Paying Food Delivery Job

description:
Travelcircus is seeking a Product Manager to join the team. We're looking for someone who's passionate about building a great and innovative product. You'll be an integral part of the team and will work closely with others throughout our company to deliver the best possible product to our customers. Ideal candidates will have 2 years of experience as a Product Manager working on online projects and a passion for travel. This position is full-time and based in our great office in Berlin.
Things you will work on:

Build and extend our Platform Services and Booking Systems
Serve as the conduit between our internal stakeholders and the software engineering team
Develop the vision of our products and convert ideas into product requirements
Define MVPs, milestones and guide the team through the development process
Coordinate, implement and measure AB testing
Define KPIs and Goals to constantly measure and improve product development efforts
Analyse the market for new trends and explore new business opportunities

What's in it for you?

The opportunity to influence the development of our platform and products
Be part of a highly motivated and skilled team
Competitive, skill-dependent, negotiable salary – don’t hesitate to approach us

Skills & requirements
Our ideal candidate has:

2+ years of product management experience, especially with web-based products
Demonstrated strong instinctual understanding of UX, design, and what users want
A passion for software and technology solutions that build simple and intuitive interfaces
Experience working in an agile development environment
Excellent visual, verbal, and written communication skills
Strategic, visionary and analytical mindset
Ability to constantly re-evaluate and improve

Can you recognise yourself? If yes, send your application including motivation letter, CV, desired salary and next possible entry date addressed to Stefanie Sass via our online application form. Maybe you are going to be part of the Travelcircus team very soon. We are looking forward to get to know you.
title: Product Manager (f/m)

description:
At Dubsmash we search for bright and passioned developer who want to be challenged on a daily basis. We iterate fast, work hard, make pragmatic decisions and find new ways to solve complex high scale problems every day.
 
Responsibilities & Projects:
 

Design and implement new features using latest development tools, and frameworks while continuously bearing product requirements in mind
Work on dubsmash 2.0 and help us building a fresh version of our product which is used by multi million daily active users
Become an active member of our cross-functional team by collaborating with awesome engineers, designers and PMs
Own your code throughout the entire development cycle, and be eager to explore new technologies
Apply iterative tests to enrich your code quality next to reviewing the code of your team mates
Setup up and maintain QA & CI processes for Android

 
Your Profile:
 

Hold a Bachelor’s degree in the field of computer science, maths, physics or similar
Posses a minimum of 2+ year of Android development experience, and has previously worked on an app that has >1.000 downloads in the Google Play
Demonstrate the ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment, using continuous-integration in order to build reusable, well-tested, and maintainable software
Understand and apply latest Android Design Guidelines and have an eye for user experience
Are team player with the ability to learn quickly, work independently, and maintain a good sense of perfection vs. pragmatism

 
What to expect:
 
We are a fast-growing company with a fantastic team, marquee investors, and explosive growth. We love technology, live for data, and we look for vision! We have created a fantastic flat hierarchy working environment that values transparency, and open communication. If you are an ambitious, innovative, and bright maverick looking to make an impact, then this is the team for you.
Our headquarters are located in the heart of Berlin, at the epicenter of Europe’s most innovative startup hub. Our spacious office also offers awesome perks like a free snack bar, a wide-selection of free beverages, a game room with table tennis and kicker (foosball). Weekly rituals include friday evening moscow mules, product/tech demos, beer pong and tons of tech meetups with Berlin’s most influential startup players. We encourage and support our team members to attend conferences, and are happy to help you with relocation and visa issues if needed.
 
Please check out our beta version to see our newest product updates: https://dbsm.sh/beta_android
title: Android Developer (f/m)

Automating Dubsmash´s fast-growing multi-million users infrastructure and evolve our stack as request and data volumes grow larger and larger every month

Very good programming skills in e.g. Python or Go
Extensive knowledge of Unix-systems and databases such as Cassandra, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL
Profound expertise in cloud computing infrastructure and AWS services
Good experience with virtualization technologies like docker, kubernetes, vagrant etc. and automation tools like salt, chef, puppet, ansible or equivalent
Excellent troubleshooting, communication and documentation skills
Responsible, reliable and absolutely trustworthy

We are a fast-growing company with a fantastic team, marquee investors, and unicorn-like tendencies. We love technology, we love data, we love vision. We have created a fantastic working environment that values transparency, flat hierarchy, and fast communication. If you are an ambitious, innovative developer who is looking to make an impact at-scale then join our excellent team.
Our headquarters is located in the heart of Berlin, in Europe’s most vibrant startup community. Besides working with an international team of innovators and thinkers, you can enjoy such perks like a free snack bar, a wide-selection of free beverages, a spacious office, and a game room with table tennis, kicker (foosball), and beer pong. Transfer your spirit and fire to Dubsmash’s engineers to make a vast impact on our company
Lead, empower and drive our development team to get our hottest features shipped and make them scalable for millions of requests

description:
Learfield is actively adding a salesperson to work from Memphis, TN, for Tiger Sports Properties (TSP). Ideal candidates will have significant experience developing corporate marketing partnerships. This position will be responsible for creating a high volume of new business and implementing high-level corporate marketing partnerships for the university athletic program while also building and maintaining relationships with corporate partners and the athletic department staff.
 
Tiger Sports Properties (TSP) is Learfield’s local, dedicated entity representing the University of Memphis. In complete collaboration with the university, this team is committed to extending the affinity of the Tigers' brand to businesses and corporations of all sizes looking to align with the undeniably loyal and passionate collegiate sports fan base. As exclusive multimedia rights holder for the University of Memphis, Tiger Sports Properties manages all aspects of the rights relationship, providing corporate partners both traditional and new media opportunities with the Tigers in which to bolster their own brand and garner maximum exposure through inventory such as venue signage; event sponsorships and promotion; corporate hospitality; television and digital engagement and visibility via the official athletics website; and radio game broadcasts and coaches’ shows. 
 
Official Athletic Website: www.gotigersgo.com
 
Official School Website: www.memphis.edu
 
Learfield is the exclusive provider of marketing services for athletic departments at over 100 major universities, conferences, and arenas. Learfield’s people-friendly culture is a hallmark of its style and approach to business and is rooted in values demonstrating intentional and active care for other people. The company and its employees strive to live by the company's value statement: “build the team, grow the company, and have fun."

description:
DescriptionWith Babbel anyone can learn a language.Whether on the go, in the subway or at home on the sofa, Babbel supports those who take joy in learning outside of work or school.Since its founding in 2007, the company has grown to become the market leader in app based language learning. In total, Babbel offers 14 learning languages, from English to Indonesian. Professional courses are readily available via the Babbel website as well as on your smartphone or tablet. At Babbel, more than 400 team members from over 36 different countries work hard in order to set standards for creating a new learning experience.Changing the way that language learning is done is a great challenge, so we are looking for a QA Tester mobile/web (m/f) to join our Babbel Quality Assurance team.With up to 120,000 downloads per day and more than 8,000 hours of language learning content, Babbel is the market leading online-learning app.As a software quality and testing expert you will: Work closely with other QA Engineers, Product Owners, Support, Automation Engineers and Development teams Improve and maintain quality of workflows and procedures Plan, write and execute test plans for various Babbel features and platforms Understand software test life cycle and execute test passes, create reports for team Develop test plan, and test cases effectively and independently 
Requirements You have at least 1 year experience with iOS/Android or Web manual testing You have excellent analytical and problem solving skills, you are a quick learner You are experienced with writing and executing STP, STD and high level STR You are familiar with Agile methodologies You are fluent in verbal and written English (other languages is an advantage) CAT/ISTQB Certification is an advantage Familiarity with Digital Marketing tools is an advantage (eg: Optivo) Test Automation knowledge is an advantage 
Benefits A lively start-up atmosphere with a great team of co-workers Cutting-edge tools & technologies Long-term prospects A vibrant international team with over 36 different nationalities Great company benefits (High-End company bike, fresh fruits & drinks etc.) Start-up mentality and attractive working environment
title: Manual QA Tester (m/f)

We are looking for an ambitious Junior Business Analyst (f/m) to join our headquarters, ready to support Move24 in becoming the world’s leading removal company. About Move24:The Move24 Group GmbH is a young and dynamic start up based in Berlin. Our goal is to build the global leading moving platform. In doing so we want to design the relocation as simple as possible for our clients – at the highest quality and the best prices in an otherwise nontransparent moving market. We operate from Berlin in various European markets, such as Germany, Great Britain, Italy and France. Recently we completed our Series A funding with a seven million investment. Among our investors are DN Capital, Piton Capital, Holtzbrinck Ventures as well as the Business Angels of the Auto1Group and the founders of Quandoo.com. Due to our exponential growth we are facing new challenges and chances every day. Become part of an ambitious team, that will revolutionize the moving market.Responsibilities:Analysis of data of the operative processes and strategic tools (e.g. Pricing)Design/Adjustments of internal information systemsGenerating reports to support the decisions of the management Requirements:You completed your studies in a technical fieldYou are highly motivated and flexibleYou work meticulouslyAnalytical and numerical skills are as important as an affinity for dataAdvanced Excel skills (you should be familiar with Pivottables, Validation, VLOOKUPs)Good knowledge of VBA (especially JSON/XML API connection)and SQL (PostgresQL)You are fluent in English (an additional languages is a plus) Ability to work independently and in a teamSalesforce knowledge is a plusBenefits:Experiencing the growth and development of the respective country and market Great team spirit with fun activities and a good work environmentDynamic corporate culture and the possibility to actively shape your own professional developmentA compensation system that remunerates the quality of your work and your commitment as well as providing further incentivesCentral location in Berlin MitteQualified on­ the­ job trainingFree fruits, snacks and drinks

You are experienced in BDD and related tools like Cucumber as well as multi-platform testing (Web, Android, iOS).Responsibilities: Establish User and Component Acceptance Testing in your Scrum team Manage testing & defects in your Scrum team & ensure delivery of high quality features Align BDD User Acceptance and Component Acceptance Tests w. PO & Scrum Team Create & code BDD User Acceptance & Component Acceptance Tests in Cucumber Define & code Component Integration Tests Ensure cross scrum team testing and harmonisation (where required) Ensure transparency regarding quality status (metrics & KPIs) on a sprint basis

description: Founded in 2007, Zuora is one of the hottest SaaS companies in Silicon Valley. Boasting 600+ employees worldwide and over $250M in funding from top-tier investors, we've built an industry-leading Relationship Business Management platform that fuels the Subscription Economy. At Zuora, we believe you need a truly exceptional team in order to build a top notch SaaS service. Zuora is chock-full of game changers, innovators and leaders who want to be part of the next wave of successful tech companies.We’re not your usual HR department. We’re ZEO Success and we’re at the center of a company that drives a one-of-a-kind, success-oriented ZEO culture in which every ZEO is empowered and has the opportunity to be wildly successful. In case you’re wondering, we refer to our employees as ZEOs- people who act as the CEOs of their roles, contributions, and careers. Interested in being part of the team whose core values are ZEO-centricity, leadership, innovation and thinking big, and is at the center of Zuora’s most critical transformations? Want to actively contribute to a transformative experience and do it with a group of smart, passionate, talented, and fun ZEOs? Yes? Then, read on.DescriptionThe primary project for your summer internship will be to create educational and communications collateral around Zuora’s total rewards and recognition philosophy, programs and practices. The materials you create will be used by candidates, managers, employees, and ZEO Success. This project will likely involve the following: Researching best practices of other technology firms Learning about Zuora’s total rewards and recognition programs and practicesCollaborating with colleagues both within and outside of ZEO SuccessCreating and executing a project plan with defined deliverables (with our help, of course) If you still have more bandwidth, we have plenty of other projects you can work on, too.Educational & Skill Requirements Junior or Senior in Fall 2016 working on a bachelors in business or social science or equivalent; or, 1st year MBA or masters in industrial/labor relations, human resources or equivalentExcellent written and verbal communication skills; demonstrated proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel and Powerpoint; strong analytical skills and attention to detail; innate curiosity; excellent organization and interpersonal skills.You should be able to learn a lot and have fun working with a great and experienced team of business professionals in a cool, high energy work culture and environment, all of which are part of the company leading the way in the Subscription Economy. description:
Amazon is seeking a talented, self-directed marketing manager to help drive global awareness and marketing of Amazon Web Services’ cloud computing solutions to the Public Sector to begin an expansion of our marketing team focused on the APJ market. This is a unique opportunity to participate in the expansion of an exciting, industry-leading technology business.

 This role will contribute to marketing programs designed to drive further adoption of AWS among technical influencers and decision makers in the government, education and nonprofit segments in APJ. Specifically, the role will contribute to demand generation activities including event execution, as well as diving into the data and analytics to report on activities and better target our efforts. Successful candidates must be able to recognize the needs of these market segments and be comfortable with marketing and sales force automation technology. 

This position is based in Sydney, colocated with our commercial marketing team.

 The ideal candidate has a passion for the public sector, an entrepreneurial spirit, and the ability to quickly grasp technology concepts. Candidate must have exceptional communication skills, be comfortable with marketing tools and be well versed in digital marketing campaign development and execution.

Roles & Responsibilities
- Contribute to building digital campaigns that address the differing needs of both technical and non-technical users and buyers.
- Help execute go-to-market programs by working with the rest of the Public Sector team

- Execute breakthrough marketing activities that reach target audiences.
- Prepare and deliver clear, concise content for websites and social media.
- Work closely with the Public Sector technical teams, account and BD.
- Execute effective events to drive awareness, thought leadership and lead generation
- Use marketing and sales automation tools to report on marketing activities and effectiveness
title: Marketing Manager, Public Sector, ANZ

description:
DescriptionFor our Marketing Tech team we are looking for a Senior Frontend Software Engineer (full-time) to start immediately in our office in Berlin, Germany.Who we areWith millions of regular users and more than 9000 hours of premium content, Babbel.com is growing fast while shaping the future of learning. We defined the market for online language learning, and today our product is available worldwide across multiple platforms. We're on an exciting new journey to change the way people learn languages. Our diverse team is at the forefront of the user journey, supporting the marketing department to promote our product. Using innovative marketing technologies, iterative development methods, and empirical data, we work to continuously optimise our product and processes.How we workOur team is organized in full-stack features teams. That means that our teams do everything from concept, UX/UI to analytics and DB, and of course web development. We create our product in an agile manner, and have dynamic and a fast growing team. We are continuously trying to identify problems and optimizing our agile engineering and management practices.Whom we looking forYou are a passionate Frontend developer with deep technological know how that loves to develop great products. You have an eye for details, and think that quality is a must. You enjoy working in a fast moving and diverse company. You strive to make your environment one where everyone shares the goal of delivering outstanding product increments to our customers, as quickly as possible.Responsibilities: Work in a cross-functional, agile (SCRUM) team closely together with designers and product owners to deliver sleek and intelligent solutions for the product-marketing channels. Deliver high quality apps, from design to production in a short sprint cycle, iterating on new features. Help to multiply knowledge and educate teams about frontend practices Take ownership of features, work with the team and stakeholders to implement great functionality and a stunning user experience. Work closely together with other engineering disciplines (backend, mobile, devops) to ensure seamless user experience and efficient overall architecture. Identify and implement innovative solutions/architecture and have strong focus on long-term stability and maintainability of our code base. 
Requirements 4+ years experience building frontend applications A deep understanding of Javascript as a language, and best practices Experience with implementing user interfaces that work across device capabilities and screen sizes Experience with automatically testing frontend applications Experience with product development from concept to maintenance, in an agile environment Experience with design and consumption of REST-based APIs Passion about Web Standards Experience with optimizing frontend performance Software development talent proven by great work results/experience, hobby projects or open source contributions Great skills in engaging and uplifting team members to grow their professionality Fluent in English OPTIONAL: Eye for design and usability details OPTIONAL: Experience with Ruby on Rails 
Benefits Deliver an exciting product that changes the way of learning for millions of users worldwide Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth Potential within a fast growing team Participate in hackdays, technology brown-bags, peer-learning sessions A lively startup atmosphere with friendly working hours Long-term prospects A vibrant international team from over 36 different nationalities Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Berlin scene Great company benefits (High-End company bike, fresh fruits & drinks, Hackathons, onsite language courses etc.) Check out our jobs page, our blog and our techblog to get an impression of how we work at Babbel!

description:
OUTFITTERY is Europe’s biggest Personal Shopping Service and we have a clear mission: We build the future of menswear shopping. Our goal is to make men happy!
You want to have a lot of freedom and deep insights, as well as personal responsibility? You want to get to know various personalities in a great, international team?
Then become part of our team as a Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f) and support our company on the way to even greater success.
 
Your tasks:
Our customers are Outfittery employees, and we support the systems they rely on to keep the business growing and information safe. We use a combination of open source and off-the-shelf technologies, plus many of the tools developed to run outfittery.de. You will be responsible for our growing Linux environment by solving configuration management, authentication, and scaling problems. This is a combination infrastructure systems engineer with software development skills to enable better scaling through good tooling
Further tasks include:

Owning the automation of the infrastructure platform, and driving the development of new features of our self service portal
Working on bringing Outfittery engineering practices into infrastructure operations, allowing us services to utilize the vast resources available in our data centers
Sharing an on-call rotation, together with your engineering team, and be an escalation contact for service incidents
Partnered alongside the best engineers in the industry on the coolest stuff around, the code and systems you work on will be in production and used by thousands of users

 
Your profile:

You graduated from your studies in the field of Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical discipline or equivalent experience
You have at least 3 years of experience with UNIX and strong understanding of basic internet protocols (TCP/IP, OSI Layers, VPN, VLANs, DHCP, DNS etc.)  
You have 3+ years of experience of working with basic large-scale high available environments (such as load balancing, Tomcat, nginx, CDN’s), even if you haven’t worked on one
You have 3+  years of experience using configuration management software like salt, kubernetes, chef, puppet etc.
You have 3+ years of work experience or strong knowledge of continuous integration and continuous deployment
Your are fluent in at least one scripting language (bash, python, perl)
You have 3+ years of experience handling configuration and maintenance of common applications such as Tomcat, nginx, Apache, memcached, elasticsearch, rabbitMQ, MySQL, PostgreSQL
You have experience with virtualization (Xen, kvm) and cloud server management
You have the knowledge of monitoring tools such as Zabbix, Nagios and New Relic
Your have experience using Windows servers is a plus
You have knowledge and/or interests in a containerized deployment environment such as docker
You have the ability to rapidly learn new development languages
You have sharp and tenacious troubleshooting skills: you can fix anything
You're fluent in German and in English, any additional language is a plus
You have the burning desire to “Move Fast and Be Bold”

 
We offer:

An exciting workplace in a motivated team with flat hierarchy
A dynamic company with short and efficient decision making processes
Air, love, life and work in the Berlin Startup-Scene

 
Intrigued? Then send us your application with your salary expectations and possible starting date. Your contact person is Iris Hay.

description:
OUTFITTERY is Europe’s biggest Personal Shopping Service and we have a clear mission: Take the pain out of shopping for men! This we achieve by offering the best personal service for our customers and create an exceptional user experience.
We are looking for a Head of Product Management to lead a talented product team on this mission. 
In this role you will own, communicate and accelerate our product roadmap. You’ll be deeply involved in defining and executing the evolution of our product strategy. You’ll contribute to the product vision, translate the vision into detailed product roadmaps, and lead the cross functional delivery of the product, driving all product initiatives through the entire product lifecycle.
The Head of PM will work hand in hand with our IT & Data Department and will unify forces to drive our company's product strategy. He will directly report to the CEO. Since this is an important and strategic role within the company our expectations are equally high.
Your tasks: 

You manage a very good and talented product team of 4 to 5 people
You establish a shared vision across all stakeholders by building consensus on priorities leading to product execution
You identify and prioritize customer requirements and execute them according to the company´s OKR Goals for the bi-weekly sprints
You are a strong sparring partner on our way to a thoroughly business value-driven culture across all departments and levels
You are a source of knowledge and transparency for your internal stakeholders and work closely with Data, Sales, Marketing and Design
If you see some opportunity make life easier for customers or stakeholders nothing will hold you back to bring this to life 

That´s what you have to offer:

You managed a product team for at least 1-2 years
Your total product management experience is 4-5 years
You are a very data driven person and get excited about market studies, data analyses and AB Tests
Everything you do you want to make measurable via KPI’s
You totally understand how to closely collaborate with engineers and what they need from Product Management to deliver outstanding products
You live and breathe Agile methodologies and mindset
You have exceptional communication and presentation skills
You have exceptional organizational and analytical skills
You have strong personal interest in the fields of E-Commerce, Usability, mobile development and process optimization. BPMN knowledge is a plus

 
 What we offer you:

A smart team which is eager to change retail forever
A well funded start-up in the fast moving space of fashion retail
A very ambitious and focused team working with OKRs and company-wide scrum
Lots of responsibility, independence and creativity
Live, love and breath the true Berlin Industry Changer spirit of Berlins startup scene

 
Intrigued? Then send us your application with your salary expectations and possible starting date. Your contact person is Iris Hay.

description:
Stance is looking for a Graphic Designer to be part of brining the uncommon thread to life.  Creativity and a collaborative outlook will be cornerstone attributes of becoming a Graphic Designer here at Stance. If you would like to play a critical role of unraveling the spool of convention, then please keep reading.
 Graphic Designer Summary:
 The Graphic Designer will collaborate with the Art Director, Graphic Designers, and the Project Manager to execute design from concept to completion. This person will be responsible for the design of graphic projects such as collateral material, environmental graphics, catalogues and magazines, corporate identity and branding, and seasonal brand campaigns from concept to completion.
 This person will create visual design including concept, layout, typography, illustration, and logo/icon design for a variety of applications.
The Graphic Designer’s primary responsibility is to create and organize an unparalleled and uncommon final product. Blending creativity and technical proficiency the Graphic Designer shapes and delivers a final product that satisfies the objectives of the creative brief.
 As A Graphic Designer here at Stance you will:

Support the team’s initiatives by producing strategic visual solutions and working collaboratively to further develop and enhance brand goals.
Champion design, production, and layout. 
Successfully navigate organizing and preparing files for print production.
Apply designated naming conventions, and will be skilled in file formatting, digital asset management and workflow.
Check in with the Project Manager for job delegation.
Use Macintosh based programs, Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator), Adobe Acrobat, and Adobe Keynote with expert proficiency to deliver final products.
Seek continuous improvement and are respectful and considerate to colleagues.
This job may involve other duties as assigned and the job description may be revised as necessary

 Requirements:

Provide a PDF or online portfolio with samples of relevant work
Expert skills in Mac OS and Adobe Creative Suite with a strong emphasis in Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat, and Keynote
Working knowledge of MS Office Suite
Ability to handle overlapping projects and complete work on time
Detail oriented and highly organized with attention to time management
Exceptional work ethic and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Must be creative, organized, and efficient with a positive attitude
Be willing to take direction and make revisions as necessary
Seek continuous improvement and are respectful and considerate to colleagues
Ability to think creatively
Works well with a team
Communicates clearly and effectively
Manages time efficiently
Demonstrates strong organizational skills

 Education / Experience:

 Four years of experience in graphic design position

 Company Culture:
The Stance work life balance is the stuff you've only heard about. In addition to competitive compensation and generous benefits you will enjoy fresh daily organic breakfast and lunch prepared by in-house chefs. We offer talent development programs like our CEO’s book club and our Entrepreneur Speaker Series. It's a set up that's all about helping you find flow.  Best of all, you'll do all this alongside genuinely kind people who will inspire you in beautiful San Clemente, CA.
title: Graphic Designer

description:
With the Uncommon Thread as our mantra Stance is an original brand specializing in socks, based in creativity and built on a culture of originality.

Stance is looking for a Men’s Performance Product Designer to join our creative team. Under the direction of the VP of Design, you will blend form and function and creating designs for the sport and performance area of the product line.  Product categories include: Athletic, Basketball, Running, Golf, Motocross, Snow, Outdoor and Skateboarding.
This person must have an understanding of the apparel trend lifecycle, seasonal market expectations, and be able to create commercially viable product.  This position requires exceptional design skills and understanding of sock construction, print, pattern and color theory.  This person must be able to create original designs, prints and artwork.
AS THE MEN’S PERFORMANCE PRODUCT DESIGNER YOU:

Must be familiar with all stages of design development lifecycle. 
Will be required to complete market research, creative briefs, mood boards, color palettes, rough sketches, design options, and final artwork.
Must be able to create multiple colorways for a variety of styles each season. 
In addition to design work, this person will work with Category Directors, merchandisers, and product development teams in collaboration to bring product designs to life.
This person must be able to create and edit original artwork, prints and patterns in multiple styles and mediums.
This job may involve other duties as assigned and the job description may be revised as necessary.

 REQUIREMENTS:

Provide a PDF or online portfolio with samples of relevant work
Committed to supporting and maintaining company culture
Expert skills in Mac OS and Adobe Creative Suite with a strong emphasis in Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat, and Keynote
Working knowledge of MS Word, Excel
Ability to handle overlapping projects and complete work on time
Detail oriented and highly organized with attention to time management
Exceptional work ethic and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Must be creative, organized, and efficient with a positive attitude
Be willing to take direction and make revisions as necessary

 EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE:

 Bachelor’s degree in design and/or 6+ years merchandising experience.
Athletic Apparel or footwear knowledge and experience a plus.

 COMPANY CULTURE:
The Stance work life balance is the stuff you've only heard about. In addition to competitive compensation and generous benefits you will enjoy fresh daily organic breakfast and lunch prepared by in-house chefs. We offer talent development programs like our CEO’s book club and our Entrepreneur Speaker Series. It's a set up that's all about helping you find flow.  Best of all, you'll do all this alongside genuinely kind people who will inspire you in beautiful San Clemente, CA.

Development

Entrepreneurial

description:
As a commune of creativity, STANCE is dedicated to the spirit of individuality. Celebrate bold expression with free-thinking fabric that becomes thread poetry in motion. Send a crystal clear mixed message that's silently loud and quietly bold.
Software Engineer Position Summary:
This isn't your normal, run-of-the-mill opportunity, and it’s in the type of work environment you have only heard about. As part of the Ecommerce team at Stance, you will have the opportunity to innovate Stance’s service-based Ecommerce platform, working with technologies such as AngularJS, MongoDB and node.js.
You will have the opportunity work with product owners and create user stories (including epics), and then define tasks and work estimates for each user story. Executing on tasks with precision, and maintaining close collaboration with the product owners and other team members throughout the development cycle will ensure Stance remains sharply poised on every digital outlet.
Stance is up to big things in the digital space – come be a part of creating it! 
Below are the Essential Duties for a Software Engineer at Stance:

Follow test-driven development methodologies
Write well-documented code
Create forward-looking solutions to business challenges
Design scalable, service-oriented architectures
Architect solutions that are optimized for both desktop and mobile experiences
Provide technology expertise and leadership within the team
Rapidly learn and leverage new technologies and train other team members on those technologies
Perform code reviews and enforce best practices

 Qualifications, Knowledge & Skills:

B.S. in Computer Science, or equivalent experience.
5+ years of progressive development experience.
Expertise with JavaScript and Python.
Deep knowledge of HTTP, HTML5 and web sockets.
Experience with PHP and MySQL.
Familiarity with Agile Software Development methodologies.
Demonstrated passion for development, with contributions to open source projects being a huge plus.

We would love to hear from you if this sounds like a role you would crush!
title: Software Engineer

description:
Where are we based?
Alongside our US and, French office, the DE is one of our main European offices for numbers of employees and business opportunities. Our working environment has been designed to innovate, create and exceed our goals.
Position Summary
Teads has an immediate opportunity for a Marketing Intern who is passionate about technology, innovation and online video advertising to join our marketing and DE team based in Hamburg.
Who are we looking for?
As the Marketing Inter, you are a fully involved in business development strategies, working with the DE Managing Director and the Marketing Director EMEA to shape the marketing and communication strategy for Teads DE. This role will be responsible for learning how setting a strategy that transforms the way Teads are positioned as a brand in Germany. The position incorporates all aspects of marketing and communication including driving a top-notch industry presence, identifying and participating in the main DE events, driving the right mix of events, developing key messages for all sales teams, developing and coordinating specific press relations campaigns, leveraging data and content into interesting sound bites for the press, the advertisers and the media agencies, writing and pitching in press releases or sales decks. Our vision is to be the DE leader in Online Video Advertising and this role is crucial to achieve this goal. 
We are looking for and ambitious, highly articulate individual someone who is passionate about the marketing, ideally with already established connections within the online advertising industry. This is a full time position based in our german office in Hamburg.
Requirements

Study in the field of communications and marketing with the ability to demonstrate knowledge of a broad range of communication activities – media, websites, publications, marketing, social media, events, etc.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills
Ability to work on a diverse range of tasks at the same time under pressure and in a non-precious way
Proven experience working with social media platforms, such as Facebook, Twitter and YouTube
Excellent writing skills
Excellent spoken and written English
Proven to be a proactive and diligent self-starter with an ability to co-ordinate and prioritise, utilising resources effectively
Strong organizational skills with very high attention to detail
Comfortable with a fast-paced, always-on environment
Computer literate with good MS Office Skills

Contact SMB prospects by phone and email (60 - 80 calls per day)

Compensation includes a base salary + commissions = ~$60K OTE first year (Earnings are uncapped)

You have an eye for detail

Write code for back end processes, RESTful public web api’s, and, of course, our industry leading website.

Propose and implement performance optimizations and scaling strategies.

5+ years experience in web development
PHP, HTML, XML, JavaScript, CSS
Object Oriented development
MySQL - both SQL query language and database structure/design

Big plus if the candidate has:  
 

Good communication with Javascript developers and UI Designers
A friendly willingness to compromise and play nice with others
A service-minded attitude

description:
The Organization
Search for Common Ground (SFCG) is an international non-profit organization that promotes peaceful resolution of conflict. With an annual budget of $35M, headquarters in Washington, DC and a European headquarters office in Brussels, Belgium, SFCG’s mission is to transform how individuals, organizations, and governments deal with conflict – away from adversarial approaches and toward cooperative solutions. SFCG seeks to help conflicting parties understand their differences and act on their commonalities. With a total of approximately 600 staff worldwide, SFCG implements projects from 56 offices in 35 countries, including in Africa, Asia, Europe, the Middle East, and the United States.   
 
Summary of Position
 
Search for Common Ground (SFCG) seeks a Director of Financial Reporting to provide leadership and management of its consolidated financial reporting as well as management reporting. Supervised by the Chief Financial Officer, s/he oversees the monthly financial closings of the US and Belgium-based affiliate. 
 
Responsibilities
 

Ensure timely and accurate monthly financial closings for SFCG US and SFCG Belgium entities in accordance with GAAP and IFRS, respectively.  Supervise the vetting and consolidation of the country office financial reporting in the corporate accounting system.
Develop and ensure sound internal controls are implemented for financial and management reporting.
Manage the timely completion of annual audits for both the US and Belgian entities, and support the preparation of the IRS Form 990.
Resolve any audit internal control findings to strengthen systems as needed.
Resolve findings on external audits.

 
As job descriptions cannot be exhaustive, the position holder may be required to undertake other duties that are broadly in line with the above key duties.
 
Minimum Qualifications
Essential

Certified Public Accountant (or equivalent certification for a country other than the United States)
A minimum of five (5) years of experience in accounting and financial management.

 
 
Desired

Fluency of French or Arabic  preferred
Working knowledge of nonprofit grants and contracts financial management in a multi-donor environment, including USG / EU Donor Guidelines and USG Regulations (inc. OMB Circulars and audits under A-133)
Knowledge of Great Plains accounting software
Experience with international donors

 
Salary:  Commensurate with experience and education, with excellent benefits
 
To Apply:  Application Deadline: Please send a cover letter and current resume to https://sfcg.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=319.   We are looking to fill this position immediately, but with the right candidate. No phone calls please. Only applicants invited for an interview will be contacted. Please see our web site www.sfcg.org for full details of our work.

We are currently hiring for our new in vitro fertilization lab, Boviteq USA in Monona, WI and are looking to hire two full time employees. Hours are typically 35-40 per week, with weekend work on a rotational basis as well as some holiday and overtime hours required. Duties include maturation, fertilization and culture of bovine oocytes.  Additional duties include but are not limited to freezing, grading, and packaging of embryos for shipment, record keeping, and care and maintenance of equipment.  We are looking for employees with a technical college degree or diploma.  No experience is necessary but knowledge of microscopes, pipetting, and aseptic techniques is an advantage.  You must be able to work independently and in a team, have good communication skills, and be reliable.

description:
Herjavec Group’s Security Consultants act as security advisors and pragmatic management consultants that can speak to the current threat landscape and have the ability to communicate effectively with senior members of a client management and/or executive teams. The consultant should have a depth of knowledge and experience in Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) and Privacy. However, at some level, should also be able to speak to the breadth of the security landscape. The consultant will provide subject matter expertise during consulting engagements, which assess a client’s security capabilities in the policy, process, technology or organizational areas. The consultant also identifies gaps and recommends cost effective best practices to reduce client risk and increase their understanding of security and privacy risk.
Responsibilities
Core Consulting:

Demonstrated communication and presentation skills
The ability to lead project teams and be a primary facilitator
Demonstrated written skills
Comfortable working in a project based model the values client service
Ability to lead and shape client expectations
Help drive pursuits and engage in complex deals, matching outcomes to expectations
Ability to work easily with diverse and dynamic teams

Skills:

Demonstrated knowledge in one or more of:

GRC
Security Operations
Application, Data, Infrastructure or Mobile Security


Demonstrated knowledge and use of standards and legislation, (e.g. ISO 27001, PIPEDA, SSAE 16, COBIT)
An understanding of current and legacy technologies used for the protection of a technology environment (e.g. Firewalls, Intrusion Detection Systems, Security Incident and Event Management, etc.)

Desired Skills and Experience

Bachelor’s Degree
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in security consulting or security management
Basic knowledge in working across diverse teams to facilitate solutions
Industry certification (e.g. CISSP, GIAC suite, EC-Council) is required
Strong time management skills; self-directed, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to present ideas and results to technical and non-technical audiences
Strong Project methodology and ability to work closely with project managers
Superb customer relations and the ability to interact with customers at all levels.
Ability to gain management support and work effectively at all levels across the organization and across department
Team oriented, with extensive experience in working in complex technical projects
Contributing to continuous growth of the Security Solutions practice through mentorship, identification of new opportunities and development of security solutions
Previous consulting firm experience is an asset
Fluent in English

Travel:
Position requires approximately 25% travel.
About Herjavec Group:
Dynamic IT entrepreneur Robert Herjavec founded Herjavec Group in 2003, and it quickly became one of North America’s fastest-growing technology companies. Herjavec Group delivers managed security services globally supported by a state-of-the-art, PCI compliant Security Operations Centre (SOC), operated 24/7/365 by certified security professionals. This expertise is coupled with a leadership position across a wide range of functions including compliance, risk management & incident response. Herjavec Group has offices globally including three headquarters in Toronto (Canada), New York City (USA) and Reading (United Kingdom). The organization recently entered the Australian market and plans to establish a local presence there over the coming months.

title: Delivery Driver (Up to $30/hr)

description:
You can make up to $60 in 2 hours over lunch.  Foodee pays $15 per delivery + $0.55 for each km driven.
Foodee works with the city's best restaurants to provide delicious, healthy, and sustainable food to the best teams. We are a fast moving, growth orientated company serving clients in Vancouver, Toronto, Austin, Denver, and Philly.
At Foodee we are all about a great food experience and are ambassadors of the “wow!” service philosophy. We strive to always provide our clients with top notch order accuracy and on-time delivery.
 We are currently looking for Delivery Drivers based in Vancouver that can represent the Foodee brand. The ideal candidate is organized, personable, and will always go the extra mile to get everything right. Paid training will be provided.
 You will be sent your delivery schedule 1 day in advance for you to review. The average food delivery takes only 30 minutes.  For each delivery you will be paid $15 + $0.55/km.  The number of deliveries during the lunch rush can range from 2-4 depending on your experience and our daily demand. Deliveries outside of normal delivery zone and larger orders will be eligible for additional compensation.  Also some opportunity for morning and evening deliveries.
Key Qualifications

Own a reliable vehicle
Valid driver’s license with a clean driving record
Own a smartphone with data plan 
Food Safe certified is an asset
Customer service and serving background is an asset
Knowledge of downtown Vancouver routing is an asset

description:
Hello!
Want to work on projects that change people’s lives? How about being challenged to create new, innovative solutions that help people around the world?
If you’re a talented web designer with UI/UX experience that wants to join an exciting, fast-growing company that’s reaching millions of people globally, we’d love to hear from you.
What We Do
Amazing.com is helping people achieve freedom by connecting proven entrepreneurs with the world of people wanting to start businesses. We’re building the platform for entrepreneurship.
Your role will involve improving and growing this one-of-a-kind platform that provides innovative web-based tools, a thriving community, and video-based training courses.
You'll work with our talented team of designers, software engineers, web developers, and more to create beautiful web-based products to help our members.
Welcome to Our Brand New Dublin, Ireland Office!
This position will land you right in the heart of beautiful and buzzing Dublin, Ireland. You'll join a team of talented people in a new office we're setting up in Dublin.
We've chosen Dublin because of the vibrant technology scene, talent pool, desirability of the city, and it's inclusion in the EU.
Just like we've done with our headquarters in Austin, TX USA, we plan to make this office a fun, motivating, inspiring environment in which you use your creative talents to build products that change people's lives.
Are You Right for this Position and Amazing.com?
We’re looking for amazing people, not just talented technical talent, but entrepreneurial people who want to do something big and help the world.
Most people won’t be what we’re looking for. We’re very picky because every member of the team is so important to us.
If you think that you’re exactly who we need, here’s an idea of what we’re looking for in a Digital Designer:


Exceptional design talent (5+ years)


Strong UX/UI sensibilities 


Mobile design experience (2+ years)


Ability to work quickly through multiple iterations


Solid understanding of industry design practices


Demonstrated cognitive ability and love for learning


Bring solutions to complex UX problems


Strong typesetting skills

An understanding of HTML, CSS, and online video capabilities


Bachelors degree

And, here are the values that matter most to us as a company that we expect from everyone on the Amazing.com team:


Open-minded (loves learning and comfortable with a constantly evolving environment)


Relentless problem solver (take on anything attitude)


Action-oriented (proactively identifies and solves problems to help our members)


Passionate about the company (wants to do whatever it takes to help the company succeed)


Customer is #1 (always do what's in the best interest of our members)


Honesty and upfront communication (comfortable being in a transparent, open environment)


If you’re ready to join the fun, ambitious Amazing.com team, click the “Apply for this Job” button now. We’re looking forward to hearing from you!
To Your Future,
Matt Clark, CEO and Co-founder of Amazing.com

description:
About the Role
The Math Content Aligner is a short-term temporary position that works with New Classrooms' academics team to review and develop mathematics content as well as align lessons using a rubric.
 
What You Would Do

Review and evaluate digital and textbook math curricula based on established rubric
Align and classify curriculum materials against this rubric
Review and quality check curriculum materials

 
What We Are Looking For

College degree
Experience teaching grade 4-9 math
Proven experience with CCSS-Math curriculum
Understanding of research-based pedagogical models, how students learn, and effective strategies to engage students
Familiarity with and experience reviewing K-12 digital and textbook teaching and learning materials
Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet strict deadlines
Willingness to receive and implement feedback
Availability and willingness to work evenings and weekends as needed
High attention to detail

 
Application Information
 
Equal Opportunity
 
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex.
 
Work Authorization
 
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
title: Math Content Aligner

description:
About the Role
The Scheduling Operations (SchedOps) department ensures a high level of confidence, efficiency, reliability, and satisfaction for daily student and teacher schedules and related assignments within agreed upon program service level agreements (SLAs), policies, and configurations. You will play a critical role in ensuring that SchedOps meets and exceeds these expectations by planning, managing, and performing operational tasks in support of generating and delivering schedules that result in optimal learning opportunities for each student. We are looking for someone who will be dedicated to improving our operations as we develop from manually-operated systems to more automated and scalable processes.
 
What You Would Do

Accountable for the successful implementation of daily and monthly scheduling for a portfolio of schools (or for project managing cross-team activity in support of this implementation)
Responsible for identifying and implementing optimal system and process strategies including designing and overseeing workflows for one-off, daily, and monthly scheduling processes
Plan, manage, assign, monitor, and track the progress of tasks in these processes in collaboration with other team members
Represent Scheduling Operations charter across departments (in projects, with troubleshooting, planning etc.)
Serve as lead investigator on complex issues, diagnosing underlying problems and identifying and driving toward solutions/issue resolution
Contribute to the creation of a scheduling operations competency rubric to inform professional development opportunities for the team
Perform operational and technical tasks such as entering information, running jobs, analyzing data, verifying validity of input, checking quality of output
Support Deputy Directors on special projects, tasks and team activities

What we are looking for 

Bachelor’s degree required
Strong leadership capacity with 3+ years of relevant program management or operation experience
Demonstrated experience and passion for work in K-12 education
Demonstrated interest in, affinity for, or experience with technology, technical tools, and the integration of technology and student learning
Demonstrated project management experience and skill, preferably with experience managing others or managing the work of others
Highly proficient with spreadsheets, particularly to track outcomes and conduct data analysis
Natural tendency toward innovative and creative problem solving
Strong desire to work in a highly collaborative, dynamic, and fast-paced start-up environment
Ability to learn quickly and act on your feet
Ability to handle multiple time-sensitive tasks simultaneously
Highly effective oral and written communication skills
Willing to work nonstandard hours, including starting and ending on a later daily schedule
Love of math, numbers, and data a huge plus

 
Application Information
Equal Opportunity
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex.
 
Work Authorization
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
title: Scheduling Operations Manager

description:
Job Description 
Wego, the leading travel metasearch site in the Asia Pacific and Middle East, is expanding rapidly with 50 sites in more than 30 languages around the world.
If you love to work on the front-end side of web development but also have a good understanding of how the backend works, are interested in working with the latest technologies, are comfortable with deploying code daily, and enjoy seeing your work used by millions of people in countries all over the world, we would like to invite you to join our software engineering team.
We're looking for someone who:

 Knows their way around the different major browsers on every popular device
Has played around with Ember, Angular, or React
Has good experience working in a Ruby on Rails environment
Can tell us how they would style a page just by looking at the designs
Keeps up with the latest trends
Cares about code quality and thinks that testing is a joy
Has a Github account and can walk us through their past projects

To apply, please provide the following:

 Link to your Github account
Link to live applications you have worked on

Wego is an equal opportunity employer and does not accept agency resumes.
Required experience
javascript, html, css, git, ruby on rails

description:
New York Habitat:  New York Habitat ( http://www.nyhabitat.com ), is a successful recognized International Real Estate & Travel Agency specialized in the Furnished Rental, Bed & Breakfast and Vacation Rental markets in New York, Paris, London and the South of France.
About your job at New York Habitat
We are looking for brilliant individual to join our Social Media Department. A first experience at New York Habitat is a great way to develop your skills in a wide variety of areas.
During this experience, you will have the opportunity to contribute your ideas toward handling new challenges; you will also develop your communication skills and will become more efficient in your work organization and time management.
Our reliability strives from our dedicated team members who create a gratifying and exciting work environment.  
 
If you are a quick learner, accustomed to social media websites, and have extraordinary interpersonal skills, we encourage you to apply.
This is an exciting opportunity which will allow you to display your Social Media strengths while gaining exposure to the Real Estate market.
 
At New York Habitat, you will:

Learn about Real Estate and Social Media marketing techniques.
Work with social media and marketing websites such as: Facebook, and Pinterest.
Participate in content optimization for different purposes (website, SEO etc.)
Contribute to the management of online communities, blogs, etc.
Make research and create a published weekly calendar with the different events in London, Paris, New York and South of France for our clientele.
Work directly with Marketing Department to write direct Social Media post and creating engagement.
Experiment with new and alternative ways to leverage Social Media activities (online Marketing Research).
Be in contact with our previous international guests to gather impressions on their stay in order to provide the best possible experience for future guests.

 
Your profile:

You have recently graduated with a major in Social Media /Marketing.
You are proficient in HTML
You have a deep passion for New York City/Paris and south of France not only for their popular attractions, by also for their authentic neighborhoods and cultures!!
You have exceptional English communication and writing skills!
You have deep knowledge of social media tools and proficiency in use of major social networks and online communities, including Facebook, and Pinterest.
You have experience in writing blog articles or website content and online marketing (a plus).
Interest in travel is essential to communicate successfully with our international clientele.

 If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your application through our job opportunities page: https://nyhabitat.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=78
  Entry level salary 
Check it out:
To learn more about New York Habitat and the services we offer, take a look at our Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/newyorkhabitat
Follow us on Twitter to stay connected with us and to receive our latest news: http://twitter.com/newyorkhabitat
Check us out on Google+, and give us +1s: https://plus.google.com/111169270746145415659/
Unlock rewards on New York Habitat's Foursquare: http://foursquare/newyorkhabitat
You’re a Pinterest lover? Us too! Check our boards here: http://pinterest.com/newyorkhabitat/
Or maybe you’re more of a Tumblr person? http://newyorkhabitat.tumblr.com/
We also have great informative videos on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/newyorkhabitat
And if photography is your thing, visit us on Flickr: http://www.flickr.com/photos/newyorkhabitat
.
title: Internship: Social Media and Marketing assistant (part time)

description:
Work in a unique international environment and enjoy an internship where your contribution is displayed publicly on our website and our social media network.
New York Habitat is looking for native French students to translate English texts such as:
 

Clients’ reviews,
Apartment descriptions,
Video scripts
Blog articles

About New York Habitat: New York Habitat (http://www.nyhabitat.com), is an International Real Estate Agency specialized in furnished apartments and vacation rentals in New York, Paris, London and the South of France.
We have a broad exposure on the various social networking sites (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Dailymotion etc) and are looking to extend the publication of some information throughout our multilingual networks. SEO work (Search Engine Optimization) plays an important part in all our contents.
http://www.youtube.com/newyorkhabitat (English) http://www.youtube.com/newyorkhabitatfr (French) http://www.youtube.com/newyorkhabitatita (Italian)
 http://www.facebook.com/newyorkhabitat
 http://twitter.com/newyorkhabitat (English)
At New York Habitat, you will:
-          Translate texts from different sources to reflect the style and tone (including reviewing the translation when necessary and working on its layout)
-          Learn to integrate keywords in a translation for optimization needs (SEO – Search Engine Optimization)
-          Acquire experience in working remotely, which entails a careful personal organization with regular follow-up and feedback with the Internship Supervisor
-          Benefit from a personalized follow-up with your Supervisor so as to optimize your translation speed and techniques
-          See your completed work online on our production website www.nyhabitat.com, our blog or our social media networks.
Internship particulars: Start date: to be agreed Duration: 2 months  Schedule: flexible, to be specified
Placement under agreement with university, unpaid internship
Internship for students working remotely via internet
The Internship supervision and coordination takes place with your supervisor via phone and internet.
 Your profile:
-          Perfect English reading comprehension (source language).
-          Major in languages, degree or certificate course in translation.
-          Excellent written skills.
-          Microsoft Word literacy.
If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your application through our job opportunities page:
https://nyhabitat.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=104

description:
Photography - New York Habitat Internship
Who We Are:  New York Habitat (http://www.nyhabitat.com) is an international real estate agency specialized in the furnished rental markets of New York, London, Paris and the South of France.  Our agency is currently offering exciting internship opportunities for motivated individuals looking to learn more about photography. Apartment photography is at the heart of a successful real estate company for many reasons, but the most important is to stand out. In the age of social media, Facebook, Twitter and mobile devices, having the best pictures can make all the difference.
This is what we will do at New York Habitat:

Learn more about the techniques behind apartment photography
Learn how to process photos in Lightroom
Go on location and practice taking photos of real apartments
Get hands-on experience and training 
Review your work with our skilled photographers 
Contribute to New York Habitat’s apartment photo database

You will be working with New York Habitat’s experienced photographers. They will help you understand the requirements and challenges of apartment photography, as well as guide you as you put your skills into practice with real apartments. 
You will also have a chance to improve your photo editing skills on Lightroom. We will show you the tricks in correcting shadows and highlights, adjusting tones and white balance, and improving the luminance and saturation of the photos.
We are eager to share our knowledge and learn from you, new ways and techniques, to improve the quality of our pictures. The photos you take are sent out to be processed and go live on our website, Facebook Page, Twitter and other medias. You will work with real apartments, in a real professional environment, with immediate gratification.
What We Are Looking For: 

2 months minimum preferred
You need to have an eye when it comes to color, luminosity balance and overall photographic quality
Love photography in general and all process associated with it.
Preferable camera requirements: DSLR and a wide lens equivalent to at least 24mm
Flexible schedule preferred, part time (15h/week)

At New York Habitat, we love what we do, we love passionate people and we love to share our knowledge.
Only Student with Pre-approved credit will be considered! Flexible schedule possible!
 If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your application through our job opportunities page: https://nyhabitat.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=87. In your cover letter, please indicate your start date and length of time you are willing to commit to the internship. 
Please note that this is an unpaid internship; this does not guarantee a permanent position at the end of the internship.
 
Want to Learn More?  Find us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/newyorkhabitat Join our conversation on Twitter: http://twitter.com/newyorkhabitat Watch our informative videos on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/newyorkhabitat
title: Photography - New York Habitat Internship

description:
Are you free every day from 10:30am - 1:30pm and own a reliable vehicle?  You could make up to $60 delivering downtown Toronto in one of the fastest growing startups, Foodee.  Perfect for students, actors, or people with an evening job that want to make quick money!
Foodee works with the city's best restaurants to provide delicious, healthy, and sustainable food to the best teams. We are a fast moving, growth orientated company serving clients in Vancouver, Toronto, Austin, Denver, and Philly.
 
At Foodee we are all about a great food experience and are ambassadors of the “wow!” service philosophy. We strive to always provide our clients with top notch order accuracy and on-time delivery.
 
 We are currently looking for Delivery Drivers based in Toronto that can represent the Foodee brand. The ideal candidate is organized, personable, and will always go the extra mile to get everything right. Paid training will be provided.
 
 You will be sent your delivery schedule 1 day in advance for you to review. The average food delivery takes only 30 minutes.  For each delivery you will be paid $15 + $0.55/km.  The number of deliveries during the lunch rush can range from 2-4 depending on your experience and our daily demand. Deliveries outside of normal delivery zone and larger orders will be eligible for additional compensation.  Also some opportunity for morning and evening deliveries.
 
Key Qualifications
 

Own a reliable vehicle
Available from 10:30am - 1:30pm daily
Valid driver’s license with a clean driving record
Own a smartphone with data plan
Customer service and serving background is an asset
Knowledge of downtown Toronto routing is an asset
title: High Paying Part Time Delivery Driver

description:
OUTFITTERY is Europe’s biggest Personal Shopping Service and we have a clear mission: We build the future of menswear shopping. Our goal is to make men happy!
You want to have a lot of freedom and deep insights, as well as personal responsibility? You want to get to know various personalities in a great, international team?
Then become part of our team as an Agile Coach (m/f) and support our company on the way to even greater success.
 
Your tasks:

You work closely with the CTO and with developers, QA and Product Managers in cross-functional agile teams to ensure a high standard of delivery in both customer-facing and internal software
You coach and train our teams, who have already been working with Scrum for a while, to continuously improve their work
You facilitate meetings like retrospectives and plannings
You measure and provide metrics and analyze them in order to figure out where space for improvement is
You push transparency and visibility to the next level - not only internally in engineering, but also for the rest of the company

 
Your profile:

You are a geek at heart, but Agile is your passion
You understand that collaboration and results are far more important than just following rules
You have several years of experience as a Scrum Master and/or Agile coach
You have great communication and and moderation skills and you speak English fluently
You have excellent analytical skills and know how to use metrics
You're detail oriented and have a inquiring mind
A classical project management background is a plus

 
We offer:

The opportunity to work closely with bright and highly skilled people
An exciting workplace in a young and motivated team with flat hierarchy
The chance to be part of a team that is fundamentally changing online shopping forever
A dynamic company with short and efficient decision making processes
Air, love, life and work in the Berlin Startup-Scene

 
Intrigued? Then apply online (incl. your salary expectations and possible starting date.) Your contact person is Iris Hay.
title: Agile Coach (m/f)
